text: Great food and atmosphere! My husband and I both loved our meals. The restaurant is very nice and great for a date night. Authentic, homemade Italian food. Would absolutely recommend!

I've gone twice now, and it was better the first time, but let's see if the third time's the charm. Cute little place tucked away in a little outlet, much prettier from the inside! You've gotta try the escargot, it's so delicious you want to lick the plate--and I don't even like snails! 

Warning: do not fill up on the delicious bread they give you! Also, while the creme brulee was alright, I wouldn't recommend ordering it, as it's supposed to be firm, not watery. Other than that, the service is good and the pasta is as well!

My wife and I come here for happy hour all the time. The atmosphere in the bar is awesome (the decor is great) and we always feel like we are on a mini-vacation. The drink and food specials are great as well. We treat it as a meal and have a great dinner for a great price.

Food quality is at an all time low...have been coming here for a decade and loved it...now positive changes will have to happen before I return...the last 3 times I have been here I have noticed a decline in menu items and food quality.  Tonight was the last straw, had to return my "go to" meal cause it tasted rotten.  The owners should print new menus cause the white out is beyond tacky...and serve fresh food again!
Nice restaurant and food was awesome. I highly recommend the gnocchi.

Inventive twists on traditional Italian fare. Nothing too dramatic, but everything tastes very good and the atmosphere and service are very enjoyable as well. Full bar, lots of happy hour specials and live music/dancing on the weekends. Fun place!

I just celebrated a birthday this past Saturday night and this place did not disappoint. It's the second night the lady and I had reservations and it was quiet, romantic and they also had a rib eye special that I could not pass up.  The wait staff were friendly, punctual and funny. We then later headed inside the bar area where they had a live band playing.

I held my 50th birthday here. There were a ton of separate checks. The food was great as always and our service amazing. A server Dillon whom I had never met made a point of knowing everyone's name. Great time. Great music!
Va Bene never fails.  Wonderful ambiance. Consistent high quality food. Excellent friendly service. Highly recommended.

Went in on a Sunday right at open.  Ambiance was great. Such a shame that the decor and comfort of the restaurant doesn't translate to the food. We first had calamari which was far from good. All I could taste is oil and mayo. For a genuine Italian restaurant,  it was terrible. I had the seafood main dish which had scallops, shrimp, mussels, etc. I would rate it a 6/10, the pasta itself was way overcooked. The server Denny, only checked on us ONCE the entire hour and a half we were there,  so customer service was also terrible.  On the flip side,  the salad that came with the calamari was very good. Finally we had tirsmisu for desert and that was also very good. Rated it a one due to mediocre food and terrible customer service. Maybe it's because I was spoiled with amazing Italian food when I lived in Chicago.....

Been here multiple times and it never disappoints! Recently we went and had the flank steak special wrapped with red peppers, Gorgonzola cheese, and spinach. My boyfriend opted to not get the special but after trying mine was upset he hadn't ordered the same. I'd have to say that was one of the best steak meals I have ever had! I wish I knew when or if they were going to make that again because we would be there in a heart beat. Highly recommend this place because they're food is delicious.
I've come here on Saturday night and the atompshere is awesome. I've also come here on a lunch date & the food is great.

Amazing! I cannot remember the last time I had great italian food but this, by far, is the best! I am hesitant to share with friends and family because I don't want to give away my new secret place but it is too darn good to keep to myself. I highly recommend this restaurant. My husband and I will definitely go back for more of their outstanding italian cuisine. 

The only con to this restaurant is that it does not appear to be well suited for children which is not bad since I enjoy having a date night with my hubby alone anyway. The ambiance and decor of the restaurant is very nice and classy too. I loved it. Definitely makes you feel like you're stepping into an italian bistro. 

Please try it. I think you will be glad that you did.

Such a fabulous place to wine and dine! My boyfriend and I have been coming here for the past 4 months or so, and have eaten in the restaurant + take out. Prompt service, romantic, decently priced for the environment and the food is absolutely wonderful. Many great memories here. Definitely recommend!

This is NOT your neighborhood Olive Garden in the heart of the Ahwatukee Foothills...this is Italian cooking at its best. The ambiance is fit for that "I-must-impress-her" first date or that "darn-I-forgot-our anniversary-again" make-up and make-out dinner. 

The ambiance is cozy and classy (white linens, and no red check table cloths) the staff are attentive and knowledgeable about the food...now that's important, especially if you don't understand Italian.

They serve lunch, and I've had their smoked chicken fettucine pasta, which is one of their lunch specials ($9-10?). The sauce was excellent--creamy, but not heavy, and punctuated with the saltiness of pancetta, if I'm not mistaken. The chicken was cooked (maybe grilled) just right, a bit on the smoky side to add another texture to the overall flavor. 

Now if you are on that date--whether it be with your spouse, significant other, or whomever--you HAVE to start your dinner with some cocktails and appetizers at the bar, where they have Happy Hour from 4-7 p.m. Tues-Saturdays. The appetizers (calamari, baby!) are half-off, plus drink specials. 

Bellissimo! I'm telling you...
Great place for dinner with the wife! Small, dark, quiet and the staff is very kind and professional. Love their pasta dishes. Will be back again for sure!

If you are looking for more of a Lounge hang out with good drinks and live music -with even a small dance floor --check this place out!  You can go for dinner -and stay for the live band and evening interaction -or just plan to go during happy hour or after 8p.m to enjoy the bar area where the band camps out!  The music is always fabulous for listening and dancing if you choose.  The crowd has appeared to be 45+ on the times I have visited -and very lively and interactive -but still laid back with the lounge feel.  I only rate it a 4 instead of a 5 because the last few visits were a bit of a wait for drinks when the bar was far from full.  All the staff members are very pleasant and helpful!

My wife and I have eaten here many times over the span of about 6 years. Every time the food is great and we enjoy the experience. My wife usually gets the Fettuccine Con Pollo & Fungi and I either get the same or the New York Steak. Both are fantastic. My steak is always cooked perfect and the sauce is great. The only drawback for me is it is sometimes the lighting is a little too low, and I feel it is a little spendy but it is worth the price.

Came in with my husband and daughter after a long day and night of working the business myself and it was like 9:05pm and they close at 10. We get greeted after a minute and was told sorry kitchen is closed. My husband asks why and his response was its been a slow day. That's it no sorry or can we get you something for your next visit nothing. Wow well no wonder your not very busy when you have service like that and you close early because you don't feel like staying open. Way to run a business I tell ya. Don't know if we will be returning and hopefully I can take down my 5star I gave them when we first tried this place. SMH what a joke!

We started our date night here and were very disappointed. We were looking for wine and live music and found this on Yelp. We arrived at 7:30 for dinner, but the music here does not start until 9:00. That's on us - but just so you know, it starts at 9:00, a bit too late for dinner. The servers spent more time chatting at the bar than serving their tables.
We ordered the lamb and it was very fatty. We were scrapping fat off the top to get to the meat. I rarely turn food down, but I couldn't eat this dish.  We decided to order dessert to pass the time and wait for the music to start. The cheesecake was not fresh or made in house. We decided to go back to yelp and see if we could find another wine bar near by  to save our night. Check out My Wine Cellar for better food, service, pricing and music.

What an amazing mid morning lunch I had at VaBene Restaurant.  I dined divinely, I felt like a queen being served ALL delicious foods, the ambience of the atmosphere was absolutely delightful as my head bobbed to the soothing, smooth jazz, soooo relaxing. I was in a wonderful zone accompanied by me, myself, and I.  I just had a Grand old time.  I started out with an ice tea, tasting the tea leaves distinctively, which was really good, great soup and salad, I had the works! um good! yum, yum, yummy, blackened shrimp in my warm spinach salad.  It was very good, the warmness of the salad was different and I liked it!   I requested no alcohol in any of my food and was obliged by the chief.  My entrée veal parmigiana was made specifically for me without any alcohol and delicious.  I conclude that I was very impressed with my service, food, atmosphere and manager interaction.  I felt very welcomed and not at all awkward dining alone.  I would return in a heartbeat, I had an excellent experience at VaBene!
Amazing atmosphere.  Terrific service and drinks.  The food is good but not out of this world, thats the only reason its not a 5 star.  Great place to take somebody you want to impress.
The band on Saturday night was extremely good. Can't comment on the food since I've not eaten there and the wine list lacked substance. These stars are for the band only.

Unimpressed with food, service was slow. Took 10 minutes before our waiter approached the table, when he did he asked if we were ready to order didn't even offer to get us drinks. The food was bland, calamari chewy and clams were fishy. Don't waste you money.

Most delicious Italian food outside of Italy. Decently priced and professional, friendly service. I would highly recommend the Gnocchi, it is rich in flavor and melts in your mouth. Had an amazing Chicken Alfredo, the missus had chicken saltimbocha that was to die for. You will not regret choosing this place, YES!

It was a pleasure to dine here. The service was good. The waiters knowledgeable about both the menu and the wine list. The food was well prepared and nicely presented. I dined with two friends. We all ordered different dishes which we thoroughly enjoyed. The portions were more than amble. The ambience was nice. Loved the decor and the fact we could carry on a conversation with normal voices. Definitely will return.

The server was very inattentive here.  It was our anniversary and this was poor experience.  The server never checked back and was so absent from the table we couldn't even order wine.  I food was just ok.   My wife wanted salmon and they had run out at 6:30 on a Friday.  

The kicker is my open table email stating we didn't show for our reservation.   Makes since because we did feel invisible. 

We will not be going back.
Amazing Service. There's a band that plays on Saturday night which is pretty cool, if you want to sit and talk they have a separate dinning room.

I'm so disappointed I like this restaurant.  And the decor and service is good.   My wife and I had dinner  Tuesday night.   I had pasta rigatoni and my wife asked about the special.    It sounded good a white fish grouper I think.  With a bed of a pasta.     It was ok nothing to write home about.   My pasta was good as usual under $15.     But when I got the bill $28.00 for the fish plate.  It was worth half  at best. And the waiter said nothing of the price      I have learned a lesson at this restaurant, no specials for us and I will alway have the sting of $28 for the fish.      For the owners have your staff announce the price of your specials.   It felt like a scam in a tourist area.    And if you have a $28 plate make it worth it.

I don't mind this place for a drink and some live music on a Saturday night, but I would never return for dinner. I feel like a $30 plate of fish should be better cooked than what I can do at home, and it just wasn't. It was fine but nothing special. I was disappointed.

First time and not very impressed. Food was good. Service was horrible. Waited. Waited. Waited. Waited. Waited! And there was no apologies for the amount of time we waited to order a drink. And waiting for our waiter to take our payment. We literally had to walk to the hostesses desk. They wouldn't take our payment and told us to wait for our waiter. Waiter had a big party but made our table of 2 feel like an inconvenience or not a priority. So .... a lot of waiting. Disappointed.

We tried this restaurant for the first time. Atmosphere is awesome, food exceptional. Service was really good. We were pleasantly actually shocked by how reasonable the final bill was. Highly recommend!

This is a great classy  place to go dancing on Friday or Saturday night. Great Live music. I have only had appetizers so  can't comment on the food yet. But I will update as soon as I go back for dinner.

We came to celebrate our fathers birthday. We had a reserved table 18. The food was amazing and the service was exceptional. It's a very nice atmosphere inside. Newly remodeled, and it's beautiful inside, very romantic. Our beg group
Party had a variety of entrees, but the best was their gnocchi. We will definitely be back!

Best food in Phoenix for italian!! The Waiter Sergio was very nice and very funny. Gnochi is amazing and fresh can't ever find any fresh gnochi except here. For desert the tiramisu is the best I have had not including Italy. Overall this is the best place to go to for Italian food!!! :)
You can't go wrong with anything you order off the menu. Happy hour is a great mix of the Ahwatukee crowd. Very efficient wait staff. Great restaurant for date night!

Bought a voucher on Living Social and I'm glad I did! Very nicely decorated restaurant and attentive service. The menu is extensive with a lot of authentic Italian dishes. I had the linguine Putenesca which had tons of capers and olives, fresh tomatoes and a light tomato sauce. Heavenly if you love capers ant olives like I do. My husband had an Alfredo type pasta which completely bores me but he liked it. Tiramisu is not my "to die for" dessert so we shared one and it was very well done; rich flavors but not overly sweet. We will definitely return.

Visited Va Bene during a Sunday all day happy hour.  Prices are great, lots of drink and food specials. 

Grey Goose Martini's - $6
Well's - $3
Nice House Wine Options, I believe $4 or $5

Bartender was very pleasant and attentive, recommended a pizza dish that was not even on the menu and it was absolutely fabulous for $12 and fed both of us with 2 extra slices leftover.  

Minus a few exceptions, all appetizers were half off and there was quite a selection to choose from, antipasto platters, bruschetta, clams, etc.

Highly recommend this place for a happy hour trip.

Nice place for a dinner date or party. Food is great! Has a nice patio too! Only complaint, is the female bartender ignored me for 10 minutes as I stood waiting to order a glass of wine. (She looked at me a couple times) then finally another employee came over to take my order.

Just had lunch here, ridiculously well priced for the quality of food and service. The ambience is very nice and classy but do not be intimidated, for lunch everyone was casually dressed, jeans and even shorts.  Bread with awesome sun dried tomato basil butter is complimentary.  The appetizers looked phenomenal, with mostly seafood options, we couldn't decide what to order as a group so we unfortunately didn't try any =( I had the Penne con Brocolli, the garlic butter sauce was the best I've had, I mopped the rest of it off the plate with the fresh bread they kept refilling our baskets with. yummmmmmmmmmmm.

If I could give zero stars, I would! I went online to their website, made a reservation at 9:45 because my husband gets off at 9. I was hoping to surprise him. I received a call from Illeana telling me they don't take reservations past 8. I proceeded to tell her that option shouldn't be available on the website. Her response was, "Yeah, we've been trying to fix that." What a disappointment. Now I'm trying to trade my Groupon and go to an establishment that has their stuff together!

Va Bene was the second dinner my fiancee and I had in Phoenix.  First was a Mexican food chain where the waiter greeted us with a free dessert sampler after spending countless minutes describing our new home (while dealing with 4-5 other tables, too), so we weren't expecting much.  On the contrary, we were extremely pleased by what we found.

Our bartender, Randy, remembered us on our second visit which was over a month after our first.  Now, we go as often as I'm home and enjoy a solid happy hour filled with cheap well drinks, beers, house wines, and half-price apps.  After a few drinks and an appetizer or two, we're always ready cross the street to our apartment and "cook."  

Va Bene features live music at least once per week and is loaded with cougars, so bring your magnums if you're in the mood to hunt...  Great atmosphere, great service, and high-quality Italian food are enough for me any day.
Best Italian food I have had in AZ.  Pasta dishes are fantastic.  Meat entres are above average but not to level of their pasta.

My visit to Va Bene was a tale of two meals. Since a salad doesn't come with your entree, I ordered a caesar salad, big mistake! The salad was awful. The salad was small and the dressing tasted almost like mayo. I had my wife take a bite to make sure I wasn't wrong in my assessment. 

When the server asked how the salad was, I honestly told her the salad wasn't good. The look on her face was priceless. I sucked it up and ate my salad. I hate to see $9 go down the drain.

My meal was better. I had the Rigatoni, sausage, peppers in a cream sauce.  I liked the dish quite a bit, but I was still a little scorned from the salad fiasco. 

Entree 4 stars
Salad 0  stars

The service was decent. The inside was nice and had a nice atmosphere. I can see why people like this place.  To me, this place is more flash.

I don't plan to head back to this place. If you do go, I'd avoid the salad. I think other Italian places in the area give you better food at the same/cheaper rate and overall provide better value for your dollar.

Just my 2 cents.

This is one of the finest Italian restaurants in the valley.. no doubt !! 

You get a Italian feeling right from the beginning because even the waiter speaks like a a true italian... Menu has a wide spread choice. Being vegetarians, we always have less of a choice in fine dining places, but not this one.

We ordered the soup of the day " Tomato Basil", Margarita Pizza and Pasta Fusciliana ! Oh what yummy pasta !! The cheese on the pizza would just melt in your mouth. We were so full with these 3 that we cold order any dessert. So I am definitely going here again to taste the wide variety of desserts !!

What a great place for a happy hour martini, beer, great food, elegant atmosphere, and attentive service at a reasonable price.  It gets busy, so go early for happy hour and make a reservation for dinner.

As always, Va Bene is wonderful.  The atmosphere, service and food all hit the mark.  I met a g/f for lunch and, after a couple of sample tastings, we each had a glass of red wine and the special beef & feta salad.  Delicious.  We ended up being there over 2 hours.  The service continued to be attentive the whole time without rushing us.  The only thing I would change is for you to get a location in the North Valley!  I will definitely be back.

I came here with my 8-year old daughter after a day at the museum. I was a little embarrassed because I had on street clothes and sneakers and the restaurant is so pretty and sophisticated.. and maybe not the best place for my 9-year old. We were hungry and I had the Groupon that was going to expire, so we went in anyway. It was just delicious. The food was homemade, yet still came out in a timely manner. My daughter had the alfredo with shrimp and I had the gnocchi with pesto. It was so good and homemade and fresh. My mouth waters as I write this.

This place is awesome! Best kept secret in Ahwatukee!  Food is great, great drink deals...even on a Friday night!  The owner is so cool and down to earth and genuinely cares that you have a good time here.  It's so much more than a wine bar and restaurant.  Give it a shot and you'll become a regular, guaranteed!

This is as good as it gets in the east valley.  They are opening a new location in Chandler in the fall of 2012.  We ate at Tutti Santi in Tempe this week also, and had a 2 star dining experience.  It has gone way down.

We went one night for dinner because this was only place in chandler open for late night dinner. 
Food was decent. Place was full of people.

We should have stayed in the bar area to have dinner. Tyler gave us amazing service for drinks and appetizers. We  were greeted by our waiter in the dining room when we arrived. I couldn't tell you his name because he did not tell us (Italian accent!). He was not friendly and very short with us while taking our order. When we asked for a specific side dish he was very annoyed. He clearly did not want to be there. Too expensive for not so great food! 
Not worth going there at all!

i really don't get it. All these great reviews make you all excited about going there for dinner. It is a cafetaria quality dinner, served by someone who really does want to be here. Got the ribeye special, ordered Medium, came Well Done. Mashed potatoes and greens beans was fresh out the the freezer. My wife's pasta was nothing to rave about, and our guests' food was about the same. What bugged me the most was the service. Inexistant. the "server" never smiled, never showed enjoyment, he ruined our experience. Like I said, feed me but serve me like you mean it. Mission failed at Va Bene. But still, I would be curious to try the left side of the restaurant... just to see if we went there on a bad day.

I can't say enough good things about this restaurant.  I went this past weekend with a friend and am SO happy we did. This is one of the few Italian restaurants with actual have Italian servers, and authentic Italian food.  I haven't had home made Gnoki like that since my Nana passed years ago. BRAVO Va Bene!!!! I will be back many more times.
Ovo je jedan od najboji rstorana sto sam ja I mja spruga posetili. Hrana je bila fantasncna. Uslug jos bolja.

I can't believe this place gets such good reviews. We went for dinner last night because it always looks crowded. Atmosphere is a good one for clandestine meetings great music and service was good. But the food was awful. Cesar salad dressing (too much) was bottled, my spaghetti bolognese (tough to mess up) was greasy tasting. Very little flavor. Hubby's Sspecial was orange roughy with seemingly boxed potatoes, steamed green beans and again, no seasoning. Not cheap either...$65 without drinks. AND we had to find a bathroom on the way home.
 'nuff said.

Though it's hard to compare Italian and New Mexican cuisine, I vote Va Bene our best dining experience of five days in restaurant-laden Phoenix.

Waiter was superb; wine list, great; all five entrees at our table were pronounced "excellent".  I later dreamed about my pasta with chicken, mushroom in a creamy sauce.  For dessert: wonderful tiramisu.

Like many area finds, Va Bene is in a strip mall.  It's inconsequential once you step in the door.

Go here when you've had a bellyful of everything chile-related.
The food is outstanding, we have been here several times and we are never disappointed. The wait staff is very friendly, we always feel taken care of. The ambiance is very calming and sexy.

Best Italian food in tukee hands down. Incredible HAPPY hour. Don't know what's better ... The bacon wrapped shrimp with that incredible sauce , the bisque , or that homemade butter with the bread. Service is always perfection. Both owner and manager sasha are always eager to please with great service and awesome meals. Would recommend for any happy hour , special occasion , or a romantic date night out.

Hands down the best Italian restaurant I've been to in Phoenix yet. We ordered the caprese salad for the appetizer and it was spot on. The tomato basil soup was delicious. For our entree, we got the frutti de mare and linguine puttanesca which were both amazing! The frutti de mare had plenty seafood n wasn't digging to find the seafood. It wasn't overwhelmed with pasta. The linguine dish had capers, olives and anchovies and had an amazing flavor. We ordered both dishes spicy and it didn't disappoint. The server was very attentive which made our experience even better. Highly recommend. Will be coming back soon!

Wow is an understatement! It has been several years since I've eaten at Va Bene Italian Restaurant. Celebrating my birthday with my husband and son on Dec. 19 was a special dining experience. I have no idea what they do to their Calamari Rings, but this was an appetizer extraordinaire. There was a special sauce that was extremely tasty, but the rings themselves were prepared in a way to make them very soft. I have eaten this appetizer at many different restaurants, but this is hands down the best. They kept bringing a basket of sliced bread with a orange-colored butter that was exquisite to the tongue. Then the main course of a chicken with fettucine was very well prepared. The healthy portion allowed me to take some home and much to my surprise heated up well two days later. The Server and Manager were very attentive also. I have no qualms about recommending Va Bene in Ahwatukee for a fine dining experience.

I loved this restaurant. The server was a huge sweetheart think his name was Dylan not positive but he was great always checking on me, making great conversation and even gave a sample of two different domestic red wines. The chicken with fettuccine and mushroom was amazing the sauce was light not overwhelming. The atmosphere was nice as well. I live in Los Angeles but if I ever come back to visit I'm definitely coming here.
I had my sons graduation dinner here. The food was perfect and the service was amazing.  They were very attentive to details. Everyone loved the food and desserts.

Tried this place for the first time tonight. They have a great patio and a huge indoor bar. I had the chicken Alfredo and it was delicious. Huge menu too including quite a few pasta dishes, pizza, salads and a variety of non pasta main courses. Service was great too. Will definitely go back.

I can't believe I've never been here before!! I came with my family and had a great experience. We sat in the dining room which is beautiful and our server told us they had recently renovated the entire restaurant. The decor is warm and inviting in the dining room and the lounge, very tasteful and romantic. The wine reccomendations from our server were spot on and we also had amazing after dinner martini's. The bartenders really know how to make a special drink!

One thing I have to mention..... I have been to Italy several times, and the Gnocchi Ala Vodka is one of the best I've ever had! My mom ordered the Pollo Marsala, which was AMAZING. We were all very impressed to say the least. I could go on about the dishes we ordered but there were 12 of us and that could take a while.  All in all, we had a great experience, amazing food, and friendly service! Even the manager of the restaurant came by to talk with us, he was very personable and professional! Vabene is a gem!

I come from an Italian house who take food very seriously so when I read some of the good review I was expecting good food. To my surprise it seems I should have paid more attention to the negative ones. Again I come from new Haven , CT where some of the best Italian food is and I can assure you I know fresh good Italian food and this was not it. Calamari should be light flour seasoned batter and what I was served was an onion ring type batter which was a bit oil saturated drenched in a type of mayonnaise. I also had  gnocchi alla vodka where there gnocchi was under cooked and sauce was just OK  a bit bitter. But I will say the most disgraceful thing was the seafood bisque it was no more than tomato soup with a single shrimp in the center . Seafood bisque should be creamy rich and vibrant also should have traces of seafood lol. !!!

Ate and drank here in the bar last Saturday. We were on the early side so it wasn't too busy but became steady towards the end of Happy Hour. 
Drink: I suggest Martinis. They are generous and the HH liquor is a descent selection. Also, trust their bartenders. Give them an idea of what you like and let them create. Aldo made us a guava one that was great. 
Eat: Grilled Veggie Appetizer. I am not sure what they do that makes this so good but we get it almost every time. Calamari. Good. Both at half price for HH. We ordered the gnocchi to split and it was great. No ridiculous split plate change either. 

We will be back again. 

Regarding the Groupon. It is a good deal if you miss Happy Hour or sit in the dining room. We went for HH and the Groupon doesn't apply.

Extremely disappointing experience- have Berta Va Bene fan for years but last night I felt like it was all about the money!!!!! The bar is I see renovation and was my Marti it the quality and price of happy hour - NO!!   In addition for a $20 pasta I do t expect to detail and shell my pasta. What a mess. Shame on you !  I'm definitely rethinking ALL the recommendations I've given. 

My even mentioning our entrees being misdelivered at our table. I am mourning my years of happiness at Va Bene

Atmosphere is beautiful. Waiter not so good brought bread out and then took plates and remaining bread away before salads, soups etc were even served. I ordered minestrone soup with pesto for lunch, it was like a clear broth (no flavor) and a can of mixed vegetables thrown in, no pasta, no flavor at all. I added pepper and Parmesan still not enough. Think twice about coming here.

One of my favorite places to go with the Italian family! The servers are amazing and very personable. Plus the Rigatoni Alla Bolognese is to die for. You MUST order this, you'll be happy you did. Also the lamb shanks are outstanding.

Va Bene just doesn't disappoint. Had dinner here this evening with the bf.  I had the Penne Salmone -- just delicious and extremely filling, so much so, that the bf got a nice chunk of it.  The bf had the Bassa Florentina of which I had a small sample -- very good too.  It's nice they have a separate dining area since the lounge can get quite loud.  May be a good place to dance as well -- don't know; will have to try it some time.

My all time favorite restaurant! This place has a great atmosphere and amazing food. I have been going there regularly for years and the staff and service are fantastic.
Every client, or date I have brought there were impressed and quickly became new customers themselves.

Coming from Pittsburgh, we didn't think we would get good Italian food in Arizona. Va Bene proved us wrong. Not only was the food excellent, the service was even better!  We were a little nervous when they put us in a back room by ourselves with our 3 children (very good kids but under 10), but it was actually ideal... we had the room to ourselves. They took their time on serving and the food was authentic. The gnocchi was a little overcooked but the manager (can't remember his name) and server, Sergio, made it right. They were both great (as were the bus boys) and made our experience at this restaurant perfect. Veal Parm (not on the menu) and Veal Marsala was delicious, as were the sides. If you're looking for great, authentic Italian food in the Phoenix area, this is definitely your place... for kids and adults alike! Highly recommend by a 100% Italian!

Fabulous!
The food was superb and the staff was friendly and fun!
We'll be back next time we're in the area...
My favorite Italian Restaurant.  Great food, and drinks, and the service is a hit. My husband and I love the ambience.
Really good Italian food.  I had the grouper, which was delicious.  Good champagne split, nice wait staff.  Friends with us had other items on the menu, which were equally as good!

So we've been sitting here for an hour now since we put in our order and still no food.  Normally, I'm quick to forgive... Especially when offered an apology, which we were.  The manager assured us our order was corrected and that the food would be here soon.  That was 25 minutes ago.  Ugh.... Won't be coming back here again.  I don't care how good the food is.... If it ever comes, that is.

This is a real authentic Italian food place. Everything is fresh so you can make your own personal adjustments to the ordered menu items (no mushrooms et). They quite often have discounts deals on Groupon!!
Love this place! Great prices for italian cuisine.on to of that $5 Absolut vodka anyway you like it and life music on the weekends after 9.great for a date our just hanging with friends

Excellent the food was amazing. Boris was a excellent server. We started out with Sasha the manager he was good too.  We were the only ones in the dining room but they made sure to stop by often to see if we needed anything. I had the Calamari Fritti and Salad " Va Bene". My husband had the Linguine Frutti di Mare.  It was a wonderful place to celebrate our 36 wedding anniversary.

My girlfriend friend and I had dinner there on Saturday February 2nd.  We didn't have reservations but we were seated without a wait.
 We ordered the Calamari and the eggplant appetizers. The calamari appeared to be preprepared portion controlled rings of uniform size. The flavor was bland . The eggplant on the other hand wasn't bad
Probably not going back
It used to be a much better place
I understand they have a new manager and a server agreed the place had gone downhill.

We spent over three hours here on a Saturday night and were treated to good service, good food, and good music. We ate in the bar, which offers full dining service and a close-up view of the dance floor after 9. Drinks were reasonably priced with generous pours. We ordered the caprese as a starter and were happy with both the size of the portion and the freshness of the tomatoes and mozzarella. We used some of the complimentary bread to finish off the balsamic vinegar and olive oil that remained on the plate. For dinner, my partner had the chicken marsala which was cooked perfectly and accompanied by a small serving of mashed potatoes. I had the salmon, also cooked to perfection, served on a bed of roasted potatoes and green beans. Too often, restaurant chefs kill the vegetables and serve what amounts to limp mushy stuff but that was not the case here. The beans were al dente and flavorful and the potatoes were crispy without being overcooked. Our great meal was topped off by good music from the evening's cover band, Uncorked, making for a very pleasant Saturday date night!

Went for a birthday gathering there last Friday.  

The wine list was excellent and we went with a bottle of Kendall Jackson Chardonnay.  The presentation was excellent and the wine was kept at about the right temperature.  

For appetizers, we ordered the Escargot and the Scallops.  I must say, the escargot came out completely different than what I had expected.  It came out in a soft, flaky pastry, and could be separated out in 4 pieces.  It was extremeley done to perfection!  The scallops were also excellent, and the presentation was superb.

I opted for the Linguine Vongole (pasta and clams in a white wine sauce).  I've had this dish at several other places, and I must say this was the best one I've had so far.  

The only 'downer' of the whole night was that our table was placed near the band, and it was a little distracting trying to talk over them.  Kind of hard for 10 people to have casual conversations to Journey.  :)

All in all, it was a very pleasant experience.

The server was friendly. The calamari was rubbery and lacked flavor. The Cesar's were not great, I make better at home. The Marsala was horrible I could not even eat it. The salmon in my daughters pasta was over cooked. Based on the reviews I was expecting this amazing meal. The tiramisu was great but would not go back without the meal being better. There was little flavor in anything. Sadly disappointed
definitely need to try this place for lunch the gnocchi was really good different then any I have ever had service was OK but for ten bucks you can't beat it going back real soon with the family

The perfect place to go to on a Friday night after the Chandler Jazz Fest - well 7 picky boys from NY say absolutely! Actually 3 for 3 at this wonderful establishment. Ate in the dining room twice prior and it was just spectacular. We went to the bar last night and were waited on by the awesome Shelly. Great wine by the glass, superb Calamari with that special sauce and then the Penne Siciliana with the eggplant and just the right amount of garlic was Bene indeed. Made me want to do my Robert de Niro " Godfather II"  impression " Bene, Bene." We also got the Margherita pizza which was great - loved the basil. Awesome band with an amazing singer. She was very versatile and went from modern pop to good ol' Bob Marley. Dance floor was jamming. Shelly and the staff were on their game and took very good care of us. Really cool to experience this side of Va Bene after enjoying Sinatra and the other Goldies in the main restaurant with the dim lighting, great atmosphere and very, very good food. Loved it! Perfetto, Delizioso, Sorprendente.

If you want a "real" review of this place, read the one from Nicole B.  I'm just going to give you my highlights this time.

First, they had Grey Goose on special for $6.  Are you kidding me?  Where do I sign up?  I saw the sign on the patio as we were walking thru the door and I knew it was going to be a good night!  

I don't typically order calamari because everyone seems to have a version of it and it's usually not very good.  The calamari at Va Bene is thebombdotcom.  Seriously the best squid I have ever had.  For dinner I had the Risotto Mare Monte--light brandy cream sauce, shrimp, scallops, and wild mushrooms.  Very good.

The atmosphere was dark and romantic.  No one wants to have a spotlight on them with they're shoveling Italian food into their face.  It was perfect.  It was a quiet Tuesday night with only a couple other tables.  Besides, we were getting plenty of attention from the staff and other customers.  Four hot ladies do not need a spotlight.  :)

Good happy hour and good service here.  Our server was there when we needed her and invisible otherwise.  So, perfect.  The happy hour prices are a pretty good deal, and the food options are a nice blend of traditional and more unique.  Try the Melanzane Ripieni - you'll be glad you did.
Best authentic Italian food I have ever had.. Their creme brûlée is out of the world!!!

I can't say enough about this place. I saw it reviewed on Check Please and knew I had to go. OMG the gnocchi in vodka sauce was the best i have had here in the Valley. My daughter loves calamari and she said it was so tender and flavorful that she wont order it any place else. She  also had the fungi pizza. The crust was perfect and the toppings plentiful. Best tiramisu ever and the espresso creme brulle was outstanding. I saw linguini in clam sauce looked good with plenty of clams. The bread is fresh and the compound red pepper butter is fantastic.  I just need another excuse to go back...how about tomorrow?

My wife and I shared the Caesar Salad and the Margherita Pizza--pretty standard. It tasted good but not amazing. The best part of the experience was sitting outside on the patio. It was quiet and perfect for conversation.
Amazingly good Italian food. This is a white tablecloth, sit down and relax classy restaurant!

Just went back to Va Bene with family visiting from out of town. Boris our waiter was amazing.  He recommend some amazing dishes. Our food was great as usually. We had a Groupon and it very easy to use.

Some of the finest Italian food my tongue has touched. Very nice dim lit atmosphere with tables surrounding a central location bar making up fine Italian food with a quality made drink to go along with.

Was looking for a restaurant for a date with my wife, went here and loved it. Great ambiance, and great place for a conversation. Had the clams with linguini in a white wine sauce, was amazing! Great work to the team over there!

Absolutely delicious! The only downside was they ran out of some of the menu items, but what they had was great! The service was terrific and he was very helpful in making decisions between menu items. This is a great place for special occasions and romantic dinners!

Me and a girl friend hit up this place on a Saturday night after going to another local hang out (which I must say was bunk after going here!) I had never been but, my friend had and so glad she recommended it. The atmosphere is very nice, a little more on the classy side, but the band playing that night, had the "classy" people gettin jiggy wit it! We sat at the bar, and I was a little mesmerized by the many different types of Vodka they had on display... yes, they had my favorite kind of alcohol. We had a pineapple cosmotini? I think that is what he said. All I know is, it was perfect! The band played various types of R&B soul music, and the female singer even belted out a few songs en espanol! And I must say, she definitely had an amazing voice! She got all the ladies on the dance floor!
Quick note on the decor, the lighting was dimmed, there was long floor-to-ceiling draperies, tones of cranberry red and champagne brown. I would definitely recommend for someone looking to take their special someone.  The seating was ample for the size of the place. The outside lounging area was also set up nice. Being from Cali, it is hard to compare places out here versus Cali. But, this one was definitely a more diverse place than the last joint we stopped at, and that is A-OK in my book!
I cannot comment on the food, as our experience was more for the bar scene, but we will definitely be back again!

Such a hard review to write because service at the bar is friendly and good happy hour. But the dining service is one of the worst I've ever had. Guy serving us didn't even say hello or thank us at end. He smelled so much like a cigarette it was gross. The Alfredo sauce was great but shrimp way over cooked. What a bummer.
This is one of the nicest Restaurant  you can find in Ahwatukee close to the busy I10 and Chandler Blvd. Wether you just stop by during happy hour or have a succulent supper try it.
EXCELLENT food & service! Came here on a date last week and we were both so impressed by the quality, delicious food and friendly service. I will definitely be coming back!

We went here for Mother's Day.  Their service is excellent and their staff is experienced and friendly.  Our waiter recommended a bottle of wine that paired well with our meals.  Their menu has a number of seafood options amongst the appetizers and entrees.  We ordered the clams from the appetizer menu.  Very good.  The pasta dishes we enjoyed were the gnocchi and seafood pasta.  Both come in a vodka sauce that is outstanding.  If you are looking for a excellent Italian restaurant in Ahwatukee at a reasonable price, Va Bene is for you.

By the prices they were charging, I would have expected a meal that tasted less like reheated Olive Garden doused in parmesan. 

On the plus side it appeared to be 40-something-divorcee's night at the bar next door... so that was entertaining.

food is amazing! And the prices are so reasonable. A great spot for very fresh Italian food.
I left my wallet at the restaurant one night and the staff kept it safe for me to pick up the next day. 
Really love everything about this place, especially happy hour daily!

I have been here a few times for lunch and taken friends and it's always been a pleasant experiance. I have only ever gotten the Gnocchi alla Vodka  so you mileage may vary.  It's so good I never switch up what I order.

It's a nice restaurant with a cool patio and bar so you can eat outside.

Try:
- Gnocchi alla Vodka

I'm always one to give my god honest opinion, so here it is..

Upon arrival to Va Bene, we were greeted by a lovely hostess who was more than helpful confirming our reservation and seating us.  A shorter italian man filled our waters immediately and blessed us with the most amazing bread and butter.  Kudos to this guy, his service was the most superior.  Then we met our waiter, he didn't seem to have a ton of knowledge of the menu, specials, or wine.  I asked for a sweet white (moscato) and it took him a minute to process, nevertheless, we continued forward.  We ordered calamari for the table, and it was pretty tasty.  I had the gnocci alla vodka and my partner had the shrimp alfredo.  My dish was less than satisfying, too much tomato and not enough parmesan.  After it was all said and done, we had plates stacked on the table so I didn't feel right ordering desert because I didn't feel like holding the plate.

Work on your service and it'll make up for the food :)

The food is to die for! I'm in love with the mushroom soup and the pesto linguini. The soup in a cream based mushroom purée that is delicious! It is a large bowl and I wish they offered a cup version. The pesto linguini is smothered in a creamy pesto sauce that melts in your mouth. I can't rave enough about the food but the service is disappointing. It is extremely slow - I waited 45 minutes for a drink and over a hour for my meal. We've decided that takeout is our best option which is too bad because the ambience is inviting, warm and romantic.
Had the duck ravioli with mushrooms. It was a bit heavy but I couldn't put my fork down. I tried to leave at least one on my plate, but it was tough. I've been happy every time I have eaten here.

As my friend would say, "This place is grown and sexy".  Love the dim lighting and the red curtains.  I love the huge bar area. Four of us girls dined here for dinner and sat at a high table in the bar area.  Our server was friendly and attentive and the bartender even came over and chatted it up with us.  

We all had wine and I went with a Malbec.  It was a good choice recommended by the bartender.  When our server brought over bread and butter, I was so excited to see that it wasn't normal butter. I love when restaurants don't have normal butter and the sundried tomato and basil butter exceeded my butter expectations.  For starters, we shared the clams and fried calamari.  The clams were in a olive oil, garlic, and oregano broth and dipping the bread in it made it even better.  The clams were baby clams and were good, but a bit gritty.  I liked the calamari.  They were light, and even thought the garlic sauce on them was good, I'm old school Italian and would have preferred traditional marinara or fra diavlo dipping sauce.

Like many other Yelpers, I went with the Gnocchi alla Vodka.  I'm an Gnocchi snob, but Va Bene passes my Gnocchi test.  Definitely homemade, light and fluffy.  The sauce was SO flavorful.  I only ordered a half order of the Gnocchi and was kicking myself after for not getting a whole order!  

One thing I did not like about the restaurant was that the music was on a pop station.  If I'm in a nice Italian restaurant, I don't feel like listening to Lady Gaga.  I know they have live Jazz on the weekends, so why not play Jazz music on the radio every night?!
Been going here since 2003 and I love it! Great food and always top notch personalized service. One of my favorite places to take the family. Highly recommended! My favorite is the veal piccata
We've been dining at Va Bene for 19 years ... Nearly every meal has been perfect ... Gracious service and excellent food ... Fairly priced ... We will be back.

I went here this weekend with a friend we used a restaurants.com Coupon and I am so glad we went, one of the great things about  having the coupon is you have to spend a certain dollar amount and then you get to try more. We were able to have an appetizer to share, we each ordered a salad and our own Pizza and shared a desert,   the appetizer Bruschetta "Va Bene" was amazing  I honestly thought it was some of the best I had ever had.  the salads were amazing I had the Insalata con Rucola it had Fresh arugula with sliced apples, pecans, crumbled feta cheese in a raspberry vinaigrette. the feta cheese was so mild the flavors melded together like a dance.  The pizza I had was the Margherita and it was delicious the crust was thin yet soft and crunchy and it was just ever so lightly sauced, and totally perfect,  My friend had the Fungi Salsiccia I am not a fan at all of Mushrooms but it still looked really good. We then shared a Crème brûlée and it had a wonderful light lemon flavor. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable and the wait time for every dish was minimal. 

The dining room though was an experience in its self it was dimly lit but still full of drama and ambiance beautiful red velvet curtains on the windows and light cream sheers in the middle various painting that looked like Picasso's and the music was so Fun Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin and the likes. I would most defiantly come here again!

Delicious food, nice ambience , excellent service
Went to Ve Bene for my birthday dinner . 

Food:  I had the Chicken Marsala Entre . It was very flavorful and the chicken was perfect.  For dessert we ordered creme brûlée and tiramisu.  Since it was my birthday I was given the tiramisu complimentary with a candle in it. (Very nice). We were told that the desserts were homemade . They were fantastic . 

Service : Excellent!

Ambience : We had dinner in the dining room but the also have a lounge. I loved the artwork and decor throughout the restaurant .  Our reservations were at 8 pm and as we were leaving we could hear the live band starting to play in the lounge. If I hadn't worked a long hard day we would have moved into the lounge for a cocktail and entertainment. Looks like a lot of locals enjoy Friday nights at the lounge.  

I will definitely return to Ve bene in the near future.  If you want delicious well prepared food, excellent service and great ambience then Ve Bene is the place.
Wed nite found the place mostly empty.  Drinks good and reasonable.  Food while good/great but pricey...could have thrown in a small salad.  Espresso creme bruGtlee was to die for!

Came here with my friend for some martinis and appetizers. I was blown away by the calamari, whatever the sauce they put on top is... is pretty delicious. For happy hour you can expect to pay a little over $4 for just the calamari and they are very generous with portions. I love the crispy-ness and the calamari itself isn't chewy. 

I loved our bartender, she was so sweet and helpful. The hostess on the other hand was awkward and rude. I am pretty sure she has no idea what her job entitles. We walked in and she gave us a rude stare as if we were suppose to be the first to speak. Excuse me, but a "Hi, welcome to Va Bene" would have been a thoughtful gesture as it is your job. We just didn't bother, we just helped ourselves to the bar. 

Please Va Bene, inform your hostess to talk and let them know what their job duties are. They are not well informed or you just hire high school girls to stand around. We've had this experience here a few times. 
The owner of the place was pleasant, sweet, and friendly. The staff who brought out our food was also very kind, this was very pleasing. Great establishment, great bartender, great food (pure excellence), great vibe, and amazing martinis.

I was down visiting my Daughter and her fiance and we decided to try this place out.  At first, I thought I might be too under dressed. it has a dining area with table cloths and candles.  I was in just shorts and a polo shirt and was not looking for a fancy place.  but they have a great little bar area with tables that worked out just fine.  I ordered the stuffed pork, wife ordered the spaghetti.  My daughter ordered some shrimp pasta and I did not get to see what her fiance ordered, but it must have been great, he ate it all! My pork was great, I really enjoyed the dish.  cooked just right, mashed potatoes were perfect, vegetables were super.  Wifes dish was very good.  I'd recommend this place if you're in town. great service, great food.  it's on the list to return to sometime.
The service was great and the food great. I had a spinaci salad and the seafood bisque. Very nice ambience and also have to mention the drinks were great. I will go back and often.

Went in for dinner last Friday. It was very busy but had no problem seating us. We sat in the bar/lounge facility where Trevor was our bartender. What a superb job he did. Service was stupendous. Overall great food with a great staff. Easily 5 stars!

Staked at this place for a friend's dinner party for 25 or so. I was surprised to see one server for the entire group but somehow with some hiccups he managed to get it done. The server would grab everyone's attention and let us all know that we need to be in our seats so he can take he order. Is this grade school class?!?! Kinda ironic but I guess it works because otherwise his orders would get mixed up when receiving the checks in the end. 

I read some of the horrific reviews from prior and major letdowns were the slowness in service but quickness in receiving drinks and salads and appetizers. While ordering if someone asked for a drink that previously didn't get one the server would halt the ordering procession and leave to go get the drink! Thought that was odd yet comical. And, surprisingly our food came out quick but it was only because it was almost 9pm after majority of the customers were done eating. 

Gnocchi alla vodka: one of the best dishes on the menu or at least of what we tried. House made potato gnocchi with tomato, cream and pink vodka. $13.95

Zuppa di Vongole:  clams steamed in white wine, olive oil, garlic sauce. The sauce base was rather tasty. We were definitely missing the crostini (toasted bread) but did soak up the garlic sauce with the starter bread. $9.95

Fettuccine con pollo and fungi: normal run of the mill type of pasta dish that can be made at home. Chicken chunks and fungi pieces and creamy high caloric white sauce share amongst three. $13.95. 

Getting our checks took years and not sure why. The server would start the same process as he did for taking food orders. So if you started last in food ordering you'd get your check last. Not sure what kind of system they have but definitely not efficient.
Very good Italian food at reasonable prices. Nice bar. Recommended. We also enjoy having appetizers at the bar and listening to the live music on the weekends.
Always solid food...highly recommended the gnocchi ala vodka I sub the gnocchi for penne! One of the best Italian spots in Arizona! Also the bread and cheese butter is to die for! Enjoy

I was here for the first time probably 5 or 6 years ago.  Whenever I'm in town on business, I try to make it by.  I like to sit at the bar so I don't look like I got stood up by sitting alone at a table in the dining room.  On my most recent visit, the bartender didn't seem that into help me out.  I ordered a drink and an appetizer and ended up waiting for about 20 minutes for him to return with the appetizer.  When I'd finished my first drink and appetizer, I had to flag him down to get him to come back over.  I then ordered another drink and a second appetizer.  I got my drink but 20 minutes later I flagged him down and asked him about the appetizer and he said he hadn't put in the order.  Given how slow the service was, I decided to cut my losses and was on my way.  Probably just a sub-par employee but enough to keep me from making any special effort to get back there next time I'm in town.

Lousy customer service. Hector the barback/busboy was the only one that cared about my service. 

They didnt bring out bread with the meal. The food was bland and overpriced

Even the hostess didnt care, wow.

Save your money, go somewhere else.
Great food and atmosphere! My husband and I both love this place for date night. The restaurant is very nice and great for a date night. Authentic, homemade  Italian food. Would absolutely recommend!

Again, my dish vegetarian style  was better than my carnivores companion. Most restaurants make you feel weird about not eating meat or substituting. So, when I asked for no chicken in my fettuccine con pollo y fungi, I thought I'd get a look of "ugh". But, our wonderful waitress said "oh, absolutely. How about broccoli instead" I answered gleefully; "yes, please"  It was flavorful and delicious.
By far the best restaurant in Ahwatukee. You folks from other parts of PHX should take the drive to try it out. Food is amazing. Service is great!  Wonderful happy hour.

Went dancing with some friends a couple of weeks ago and we had a great time at Va Bene's. The live band was amazing and playing mostly 80's music. Drinks were fairly priced and the appetizers we had were very good.  Enjoyed the crowd and we will definitely be going back. I just wish there was this type of restaurant on the west side of town where I live.
The food and ambiance were fantastic! I will definitely return. Bonus feature, the restaurant turns into a after hours club.

I'm not sure why this place has such good reviews. The bread and butter was amazing but we never got asked if we wanted more. We actually only saw our server twice. To take the order and to give us our check (30 minutes after we were done eating and after we had to ask another server). My boyfriend ordered chicken and didn't like it (surprise it wasn't chicken) and it was a very very small portion. I got pasta that was tasteless (Olive Garden has better pasta and I refuse to eat Olive Garden). 

My boyfriend ordered chicken and ended up getting veal ($8 price difference and it was only around 3oz of veal and was terrible).

I will never be back!!! Service was terrible and the food was mediocre.

The food is excellent. We had a pasta dish and a fish dish and they were both superb. The general manager Rick came over and talked to us very very nice person .The waiter Dani, was very attentive .We couldn't be happier and we will definitely go back.

This place is one of my favorites, it never disappoints. it has a dining room which is pretty fancy but you can also eat in the lounge where the bar is and lauren to live music or watch the game. The gnocchi is to die for and everything else has always been delicious! great service too and the band is always fun!

I often go to Va Bene for happy hour, they have one of the best happy hours in town! First off, happy hour is until 7:00, which is a huge plus. AND, Happy Hour is EVERY DAY starting at 4, and ALL DAY on Sunday and Monday.

As far as drinks go, in addition to beer and wine, they have a huge variety of marvelous martini's featuring Grey Goose and Skyy specials. The Blueberry Lemon Drop Martini was our favorite. In the past, I have also enjoyed the Espresso Martini. 

The appetizers are amazing, and all but the scallops are half price. And even full price, the scallops are worth every penny; huge scallops, perfectly cooked and served with a heaping side salad of field greens and tomatoes, perfectly dressed with a light vinaigrette. I sometimes get this for my meal. 

The Bruschetta is good if you're not afraid of garlic and the Antipasto Misto is a great dish to share. The Calamari Fritti is tasty, which is also served with a small side salad. (Yes, I eat the garnish.  What? It's good!!) 

Other favorites include the Gamberoni con Prosciutto (proscuitto wrapped shrimp) and the Carpaccio, both big winners! The complimentary bread is soft and served with delicious roasted red pepper butter, very yummy! The staff is always sure to keep the breadbasket and water glasses full at all times. 

By the time we are finished, we are all pleasantly stuffed, slightly buzzed, and 100% happy!

let me preface my star rating by saying i did not eat here - only a mid workday early hh break.
apparently it's the bee's knees for italian food. and it also happens to have quite a reputation for being a bit of cougar bar and the place for the 40+ single set to be seen and take home that recent divorcee and test drive his new maserati/her new boob job.

that being said, i had no desire to try this spot out. however, i was invited here for a HH drink.

when we first showed up, it was about 330, and they didn't technically open til 4, but the bartendar said it was no prob and his smile told me that was sincere. the bar takes up an entire room, a four-sided job and extra tables for more seating. an hour and a half later and this place was buzzing with the right-at-5 HH crowd and cougars were on the prowl indeed - along with business professionals you would expect in TukeTown. 

Not sure on the prices of the drinks because i was being treated, but i would imagine they were on the heftier side, given the ambiance and style of the joint. all in all it was a better experience than i was anticipating - the crowd was certainly not my style but i didn't really feel out of place. i'll have to go back for eats and see if it's as fabulous and everyone says!
Bleh. Food was average to bleh. Service good. I am from the NY area and local Italian restaurants were plentiful and delicious. Hard to find one here.

Came in earlier today for dinner. I had saved up an appetite for this place. I was definitely feeling like eating something meaty and filling. I decided upon the Lamb Shanks. Although coming to an Italian restaurant one would expect to eat something Italian. However, when I  saw this menu item I was sold. The dish came with two 8 oz lamb shanks and creamy feta risotto. The lamb shanks were fall off the bone tender and the risotto was really tasty and had a great consistency. You definitely get your moneys worth on this dish. (Two lamb shanks for $25 !) The only thing missing in this dish would have been some lemon wedges to squeeze over the dish as this was a heavy siting entree and would have helped to cut through the richness. 

For dessert, I ordered the traditional creme brulee. the creme brulee had to be at least 8 oz of custardy goodness. it had a nice crust with even caramelization. the interior was still very chill and velvety. Definitely the one of the best creme brulees in the phx area. Also- one creme brulee is enough for two!

Attempted to go on date night. 

Sat at the bar. Took over ten minutes for the blonde bartender to make her way past three other customers that were already well into their meals. Otherwise, not busy at all. Ordered two bottles of beer - I guess you have ASK for a chilled glass for said bottles of beer. Could not get the attention of the bartender at all. 

Told "Rick" the manager that she must be "in the weeds" since getting her attention was pointless. 

And this is supposed to be one of the more fine establishments in the Ahwatukee area to dine?

Being informed via social media that this establishment is a "cougar hangout" and "swinger" hook-up spot during later hours. 

No thanks.

Love Va Bene! Great food every time. Recommend sitting in the lounge and enjoying the live music, but you will probably have to get there early in order to get a table or a spot at the bar. We always get the Calamari. I like to order the sauce on the side because it gets a little to greasy/heavy with it on top. We've had several of the pasta options and never had a bad meal. My favorite is the Alfredo with mushrooms. So much yummy goodness and you'll have some leftovers to take home. The service is excellent and it has a romantic feel, but not stuffy. Excellent for a date night. Keep an eye out for Groupons they have them regularly!

A true gem! 
This beautiful restaurant is tucked away in the corner of a strip mall, but when you walk in the door it's as though you are transported to Italy.
European-style service means there is always a server (or helper) at the ready, but they basically leave you alone to enjoy your selections. We did not want for anything, nor did we ever need to search for a waiter.
Varied affordable menu choices include authentic recipes and offerings. Extensive wine list means there is something for every taste (and budget).

We came here thanks to a Groupon. I had the eggplant appetizer and the sauce made me swoon. The stuffed eggplant was good and cheesy. For my entree I had the gnocchi ala vodka. Again the sauce was delicious and the gnocchi was light and tender. My husband had the stuffed pork tenderloin. There was an herb used that I didn't care for but the pork was tender and my husband loved it. Staff was attentive and knowledgeable about the food. Classy decor.
Food is pretty good, atmosphere is good. Bands, etc are good. Staff is not great. Hostesses are snotty and wait staff is just okay.

Summary: fantastic food, wonderful service, a little spendthrift, great place to take a date, if middle aged and single, great social scene for this crowd. 

These guys are the real deal. They have escargot which is not easy to find. I little off center serving a French dish in an Italian eatery. But it is good. I am a huge gnocchi fan and they deliver. Although the bar is in full swing, the dining room remains quite. I recommend date night followed by a drink with friends..just don't expect 22 year olds doing keg stands.

Food was excellent service was amazing and the live band kept everyone on their feet. We came to celebrate a birthday this was a perfect get together place for people of different age groups. This is definetly a go to place in Ahwatukee.

Why only a "fair rating"?  I have been to Va Bene on MANY occasions.  We decided to go for at Va Bene disappointing.  To start with, I made my New Year's Eve reservation on/or about December 1.  THAT was probably a mistake... it was too soon.  When we arrived, I was learned that they had a "Special Limited Menu".  I was NOT informed of that when I made my reservation.  When I called, I specifically asked and was told the menu was normal!  When I questioned the "special limited menu", I was told that everyone was told when they made their reservation.... NOT TRUE.  I was told that everyone was called a few days before New Year's Eve to confirm their reservation.... NOT TRUE.  I was told that when confirming the reservation, everyone was told there was a "special limited menu".... OBVIOUSLY NOT TRUE, because EVERYONE at all the tables around me said they were NOT CALLED.  Besides, if everyone was told there was a "special limited menu" when your reservation was made, WHY would you have to let everyone know when you called to confirm?  OBVIOUSLY MANAGEMENT WAS LYING!!!!!  Despite their not being truthful, the choices were "adequate" (about 5 entrees) and she service was excellent.  HOWEVER, we ordered the Stuffed Sea Bass and it was warm at best.  I was going to send it back, but by that time, I was already annoyed enough by the way everything was going, so I just could not be bothered.  A few other couples who did not know about the "special limited menu" had a difficult time with the menu.  One woman was lactose intolerant and she was unable to select many of the choices including the appetizers and desserts.  They did make a special but unimpressive special desert for her (because desert was supposed to be included with the "special menu").  Another couple had to leave because the woman was allergic to shell fish and most of the entrees included shell fish or shell fish ingredients.  Bottom line, this was the first and only time I was disappointed with Va Bene.  I highly recommend Va Bene, however, I would be very careful on a holiday and most certainly New Year's Eve.  I STRONGLY SUSPECT, when I made my reservation on/or about December 1, they had no idea they were going to have a "special limited menu" for New Year's Eve and THAT is why it was such a surprise to both myself and the other guests.  Lastly, our waiter was very good, and was obviously having difficulty with the restaurant's last minute decision to have a "special limited menu".  He did a very good job and made a great effort to take care of the customer's request.

Google translates the Italian phrase "va bene" into the English term, "all right."  This restaurant is more than just "all right."

Everything here is spectacular!  I've been quite a few times this past year and I have not had anything I didn't enjoy. (And I'm not a fan of Italian, so that's saying something!) 

I was able to indulge myself and a friend at happy hour where appetizers are half off.  There were also a selection of drinks that were included, but I only allowed myself one $2 off wine. 

Some of my favorites on the dinner menu includes Fettuccine Curry. (Yes, Curry! Try it, you'll be glad you did!) The Linguine Vongole is another favorite at our table.  We've also enjoyed the Fettuccine Con Pollo & Fungi. 

Check it out!

This place has always been magical to us.  Tonight was a big disappointment.  They have made a huge downgrade in ambiance and customer service.  Could have been easily remedied but the general manager just continued to make things worse.

Food was delicious, service (Srdjan) was atrocious. After he brought the food, he ignored us for 40 minutes. No water refills, no plate clearing, no box, no check until we were finally able to flag him down. I won't go back; too bad, because the calamari was the best I've had!

I'm from Philly and am a self appointed gnocchi connoisseur.  My I laws and I are on a life long quest to find the best gnocchi in the country.  Said In laws were in Gilbert last month and ate here.  The lauded the gnocchi as the best ever.  So this trip we had to try them.  They are close if not the best I've eaten. The vodka sauce is spectacular! The gnocchi are like little clouds of deliciousness...well most of them.  The only glitch, and it is tiny but we are talking the best gnocchi in the country here, so if we find a nit we must pick it. They needed to be stirred and cooked for a few more seconds as some were not fully cooked.  The under cooked were a little bit "doughy".  All in all the are great, go there and eat them!

Server seemed bored and reeked of cigarettes. Food was pretty good but we sat outside for an after dinner drink for 30 minutes while servers ignored us. Got our own drinks at the bar before going somewhere else.

The wait staff and food are great!  The small jazz bands and dancing are a blast!!
Can get a bit crowded at dinner but well worth the wait!

Food was Very Good, not Excellent but Very Good.  Portions were good size.  Service was also good.  Ate in the lounge area.  I used a Groupon, and was very unhappy with the terms Va Bene imposed.

1.  Happy Hour Specials did not apply - I accepted that, but was surprised!

2.  They automatically added the tip @ 20% of the total before applying the Groupon.  Now I tend to be a generous tipper, and will gladly pay for Good Service.  But, I DO NOT like being told what to tip, without being informed of this before hand.  

I have used Groupon's before, and this was the first time I was confronted with this tipping procedure.

My girlfriend and I went there for a girls' classy dinner night:) and were pleasantly surprised. It's hard to find a decent Italian place in Chandler. We didn't go to the lounge area so I can't say anything about that, we went straight to the dining area. The atmosphere was really pleasant and there were quite a few people on a Wednesday night which is always a good sign I think. 

First, compliments and then critique.

The appetizer was good, we got shrimp in wrapped in bacon (as far as I remember) and it was yummy. The stuffed pork with cranberry wine sauce was delicious! Absolutely loved it. The portion was quite large too, I got stuffed. No pun intended. We also swapped the standard sides for their zucchini risotto which I thought was all right, not great, but my friend thought it was absolutely delicious. 

Now the critique. This restaurant is not super expensive but it's not cheap. So you'd think that after you're done with your appetizer they would take your appetizer plate away. They didn't. It sat on the table with some shrimp tales pretty much through the entire dinner. And for $8 we only got 4 shrimp for the appetizer. I get it, that's what fancy restaurants do but could you bump it up to 6 maybe? Still not a lot, but they won't look so lonely on the plate.  

Other than that, we had a really nice night out and will come back. It's hard to find a nice Italian restaurant that's not Olive Garden or (yuk) Rigatoni's quality so it was a pleasant surprise.

My family and I just enjoyed the most amazing lunch here. Va Bene is one of those special places hidden in a non-descript stripmall. The atmosphere is relaxing, the food is outstanding and the prices are very reasonable.  What took this visit to the next level was the 5-star service we received from Todd.  He was truly exceptional in every way, and took very good care of us. I'd even go as far as requesting to be seated in his section next time (and there WILL be a next time!)

You cannot beat the food at this place.  You will not find better Italian food anywhere in Ahwatukee and the happy hour is awesome.   The atmosphere is great and the potato gnocchi is the best I have ever had.  This place is 5 stars all day.
Great place for food and live music. The band was okay, but the atmosphere was really lively and fun!

I have been going to Va Bene for about five years now and still love it. 
It is one of the few classy places to go dancing to live music on Friday and Saturday nights. 
The manager and staff understand customer service perfectly. 
The seasoned butter and bread they bring to your table is fresh and savory. The pastas are always delicious. We have never a special that we didn't like- but the ravioli special is always our favorite. 
I must say they have the BEST escargot I have ever had. It is in a delightful pastry and goes so well with a red Tuscan wine. 
If you have any questions about wine, all of the servers are excellent at recommendations. 
The only complaint is that the smokers need to move away from the door. 
First rate!
Excellent service. Delicious food especially the tiramisu made in house.   Looking forward to coming back again.
Although there calamari wasn't too good. Their food was Super amazing their bread and butter was the best. Defiantly coming here again. .

Excellent meal. The prices here are pretty reasonable.  The food was very good, I had chicken Marsala and spouse had pasta, then we split a spinach salad.  I did not like that they charged us 2 to put the salad on 2 separate plates.  Next time we would just share.  Overall, food was very good, will be back here.

I went to dinner here Sunday night. I left  a review about how poor the food was on the Groupon review.

Hi gina,
Response to Your Groupon Comment
Va Bene Restaurant has sent you this message in response to your feedback:
Va Bene Restaurant Dear Groupon customer. I have no comment for you except that you have no clue about food. So continue to eat the dog food that you are accustomed to eat. Because you don't have any clue what homemade food tastes like.@"
Your Comment 
(February 19, 48361): 

This is what they said back to me . WOW will never go back here.

Just left. Everything was good. Ordered linguine frutti di mare, excellent, I'm glad I shared with my daughter, big portion. My husband ordered linguine Vongole which he loved. Good choice of wines. Waiter seemed to have forgotten us but we would come again if in the area

I would give the food 4 stars. It's the service that stunk (one star would be appropriate).  Our server Sergio, was terrible.  He seemed to have the snotty waiter "I'm too good to be serving you" attitude.  He was barely at our table, when he was interacting with us he was short and rude.  I would try Va Bene again, but would request NOT to be seated in Sergio's section!  Hopefully, the rest of the wait staff is kinder.

I guess this will the last time eating here for us.  I was pretty upset last night.  When we got there for dinner, we were told that due to the "holiday" they were not accepting Groupon vouchers.  What holiday?  Mother's Day is not a holiday!  And when I made the reservation, there was no mention of "no Groupon's".  Their website also said nothing about "no Groupon's for this "holiday""!  Since we were already there and my wife wanted to eat something here she likes, we decided to stay anyway.  

We got a grumpy and surly waiter who did not make my attitude any better.  We ordered drinks and those were fine and came quickly.  They took some things off the menu that we liked, so we ordered 4 large appetizers -- the bruschetta was fine (and this is what my wife wanted), and so was the antipasto platter.  But the both the calamari and the steamed mussels in tomato broth came to the table cold.  This added to my disappointment.  

So I don't think I will be visiting this establishment again.

We went to Va Bene with a coupon from Living Social. I figured that we would have no trouble spending $60 on dinner for 2 on a Sunday evening. I was surprised to see that it was harder than I thought. 

It was very slow on Sunday night around 7, and we were not greeted at the front door so we wandered into the bar. We were told we could seat ourselves in the bar, or have the hostess seat us in the restaurant. The bar was fine. The bartender took our drink orders and although my husband was disappointed that there are no beers on tap, he managed to find something he would enjoy - a Stella. No bad marks here, as not every bar needs to have beer on tap. 

We skipped the appetizers, but they look worth checking out in the future. Especially since happy hour offers them at half price. 

I had the chicken marsala - which is my favorite dish and it did not disappoint. There were 2 large half chicken breasts and a nice brown sauce loaded with mushrooms. It came with mashed potatoes and veggies, so the plate was generous. My husband had chicken in an artichoke cream sauce, and it was very good as well. 

I only have one minor complaint:  My husband's plate was cleared before I was done eating. When there are only 2 diners at the table and I am the only one with a plate in front of me I feel rushed. I am sure that was not intended, and is probably just my pet peeve, and not a reason not to return to a place that had really good food in a beautiful setting. 

When the server learned we had $60 to spend he said we should order something else as our bill was only $43. So we had both regular and chocolate cheesecakes and coffee (even after a 2nd beer, we were still under $60!). Some of the desserts are made in  house, and I should have gone with one of those.
