The cheesecake was fine, but did not stand out. 

I certainly recommend Va Bene for a nice dinner that won't break the bank. Also, even though I checked the box that says it's an upscale restaurant, we were not the only ones seated at linen covered tables in shorts. Hey, it's still Phoenix.

The service was excellent. The food was good. I was very disappointed that they didn't offer fresh brewed iced tea. For a restaurant at this level they really should be brewing their own ice tea instead of using the fountain pop.
Excellent food, prices, service, atmosphere and happy hour!! Hard to beat this place, really!

Came here with 3 others and had a great time. We had drinks from the happy hour special menu and were more than happy. We ordered escargot, clams, and bruschetta for appetizers; all were good not great....bruschetta was a bit burnt/toasty. Dinner wise I had veal Marsala and my friends had chicken Marsala, chicken Parmesan, and gnocchi, all were good not great and all were a bit on the salty side. Over all experience was great, our server Samantha was exceptional, and the meals were ok.

Enjoyed my first dinner at Va Bene ( the spaghetti with marinara) and promise to return for the gnocchi. Everything was spot on. the service was above and beyond.  Will try and leave room for dessert next time.  Fyi-- I believe happy hour deals are only available in the lounge/bar area, as it is at many fine establishments. Go and enjoy!!
Great evening out on a Tuesday night.  The food and drinks were on point and Dylan provided exceptional service.  We will be back soon.

Michelle at the bar is a freakin' Savant!  I swear.  I think the last time I was here was about a year ago and she served me a meal that unfortunately had to be returned. I don't remember why because every meal I have had here has been excellent!  Seriously. 

Anyway, she was so gracious about the problem I think she charged me 1/2 off the newly served dish (or something like that).  

Well... I walked in today (again a year or more later) and she greeted me with a Big smile and said, "Andrew is it?". I mean, holy schnikees Batman!  How the heck?!?!

So, come to the bar and introduce yourself to Michelle.  Never mind the smile and the great service... she obviously won't forget your name. 

Thank you Michelle!  You are appreciated.

We have enjoyed Va Bene for many years. The food and service has always been excellent. We were not happy with the new calamari appetiser, one if our favourites over the years. It used to have a wonderful tarter sauce with side greens. Now, boring mayo sauce and no greens. Never will order again! Still great place for music and drinks!
Our absolute favorite Italian restaurant, hands down.  Service, ambience, quality of food and drinks are all unparalleled.  Has been a family favorite for over a decade!

We tried this place for my wife's birthday dinner tonight. The atmosphere is very nice,  but a little dark inside the dinning area.  The service was okay.  The food was nothing special. I was not impressed with the chicken piccata, which is my test for most Italian restaurants. It's a simple dish, and if they make that well, then usually the rest of their food is decent.  Their Piccata was very salty, and didn't have much of a lemon tang as it should. The dinner didn't come with a salad, or a vegetable even. I left the restaurant hungry, which for a $16 dollar meal shouldn't happen. My wife just had soup and a salad, because she was saving room for their expresso creme brulee. She liked what she had, but said she wouldn't order any of them again. That says enough for me that we'll likely not be going back any time soon.

Sat immediately. Water glass always full. Server gave great recommendations. Grouper special was delicious and they are flexible with the menu. The restaurant is very clean and prices are reasonable. I would come back here for sure. Definitely a new favorite.

I had to redeem my groupon, so I took my parents, brother, and sister who have never been there.  Okay, so it was a monday and the staff was not on their toes.  The service was non-existant, but they recovered well towards the end with apologies..  My family ALWAYS eats desert, but that was not offered.   The server never asked if we wanted appetizers, my dad wanted calamari, never asked for drinks, salads, etc.  Simply are we ready to order.  My family was unaware that options for salad or soup did not come with the entree.  There was only one other table in the restaurant, a couple.  I did see the gentleman get up and go to the kitchen entrance, so I would gather their experience was not any better than mine.

I typically always go to the lounge for happy hour and food, which is always fabulous.  This is the first time for the dining room experience.  Disappointing service experience when I was trying to impress my family with an Ahwautukee location.  My parents dine out 300 of the 365 days of the year, and travel extensively.

But, I must say the SALMON and the Stuffed PORK was truly AMAZING.

Va Bene.. ahhh.. well I used to live close to here.. so if we wanted to go have wines, apps or a late dinner.. AND watch the 40+ crowd get their groove on.. this is where we would go.. bc I could walk and have some entertainment... Hey man.. sometimes it doesnt take much! 
I do like the bar...its nice with alot of good wines on the list... The bartenders have always been super sweet.. 
NOT loving much on the menu.. but I travel alot and will say my fav Italian is in the east coast.. (if not Italy itself:-) ) .. 
But to counter the effects of a bit of wine.. Id recommend the bruschetta... patio..? Well it faces a parking lot.. but again.. some good stuff to watch going down out there.. like I said, cheap entertainment.. Ive more of a choice now that Ive moved:-)

This place has great food and a nice atmosphere as long as you go early or when the music hasn't started. Once the music starts, this place turns in to a totally different atmosphere/ They bring in great bands who offer great music to dance the night away to, the best bands in town really! I'd say the service is inconsistent. They are either really great or really bad. Last night we had a wonderful server, once we finally got him to come over to our table. The weekend before was mediocre at best. And a few weeks ago we had a server that pretty much ignored us all night, forgot to place our food order, never asked if we needed refills, and was more concerned with whatever was on the TV than serving us. Then we got double charged at the end of the night. Very disappointing. Some nights I go in wanting to eat, but can't place a food order because the kitchen was already closed, when it's suppose to be open til 11pm. It seems that when the owner leaves then everything shifts gears.

The ladies room is unkept at night. They always run out of toilet paper, the toilets often become backed up, they run out of paper towels to dry your hands, and the floors are gross!

It's no secret that the "cougars" call this place home, you'll see the occasional "swinger" couple, and the regulars with their weird dancing quarks. Whatever, it makes for good people watching. But what I have a problem with is having to witness couples engaging in sexual behavior in the booths and at the bar without anyone on staff saying or doing anything about it. The staff just stood in the corner watching it all go down. This is disgusting, makes your customers uncomfortable, and a health violation if you ask me. They should have been asked to leave. Instead, I had several friends leave because no one was doing anything about it. Bad for business! My other issue of concern is people being over served. I've seen this happen on several occasions. Last night a clearly drunk gal punched her date in the face. And while he left, she stayed and was able to keep drinking. I just hope she wasn't driving. Oh, and did I mention the women smoking pot in the ladies room last night? Oh, yea, that happened too. Really people?!?! Leave it at home!

I write this review because I am in here very often and have been coming for many years and want to see some changes being made, especially before the second location opens. I love this place and want to see your continued success, but please make some changes.
This place is horible for dates what hell are u people thinking its a tacky meat market for devorces and creepers. Take this place off ur list trust me
Excellent find!! Wonderful food and service! Highly recommend for genuine Italian food. We will be back for sure!

Good food.  Terrible service from the unfriendly hostess to the bored waiter that couldn't be bothered to write down our order (and of course got it mixed up).  The food was good though and had some interesting specials.
Love this hot spot! Great service, delicious food and tons of fun!!! Live band , dancing and super place to meet new people!
Food is amazing, reasonably priced, excellent service. We love this place!! The atmosphere is beautiful. True Italian food!
Good food, good drinks, nice patio, friendly waitstaff. I always visit Va Bene when I'm in Phoenix.

Wow, my wife and i decided to go out spur of the moment with our kid. We bought a groupon and went on our merry way. All of our meals tasted like a tub of salt fell into them, we couldn't eat more than a few bites before we gave up and got the check. Our stomachs are still burning in pain and we feel sick. We took some time to order our meals and we could tell the waiter was becoming impatient. It's possible this was intentional but who knows. Never go here.
Food was great and reasonably priced with restaurant.com coupon. I would've gave five stars if the waiter wasn't so cocky and direct.

I have a special place in my heart for this restaurant, as it was the site of my boyfriend and mine's 2nd date :)

However, their food is SOOOOO good.  And I don't think its because I'm biased.

I always end up getting their gnocchi with vodka sauce, because it is just that good.

I guess this part of town is becoming little Italy as this is just one of 6 or so Italian options in the area.

This is a locally owned non chain. As of late their bar at happy hour seems to be the place to be.

I have gone here for both lunch and dates. For lunch the place is strangely empty and it can be a bit awkward, but decent.

For dates it is great, the dining room has a classy quiet atmosphere. The bread with the sun dried tomato butter is great. 

If you hear about a special that sounds good ask the price as I was surprised by my $32 mahi mahi special on one trip. It was good however.

I typically opt for the ganocci al la vodka sans chicken. The al la vodka sauce is bright and has a luxurious mouth feel. The Gnocci have a great texture, with a nice chewy firmness that one expects in them.

The parking lot can get a bit crowed, so you may need to park closer to  Kohles.

Sitting in the restaurant now ordered our appetizers, salad and dinner 50 min. ago, apps and salad came out right away and where great. Have not seen waiter (Boris) since ordering, no check back at all. Still have not received entree. The food here is great but the service is terrible.

I had been to the bar at this trendy little spot several times with co-workers and friends, but I hadn't tried their dining room until recently.

The waiter was very knowledgeable and recommended some great entrees for us to try. With the caprese salad as an appetizer, our meals were more than enough!

I regret never having eaten in their dining room before and will definitely be returning soon!

The first time I went, I loved it. Food was good, service was alright, atmosphere was cool. With that being said, I still give it a two stars from one bad impression that I got coming here again. I brought in business, maybe 20 or so people, expecting the same treatment I got beforehand. However, I was completely wrong. Our server was HORRIBLE. He never checked on us, was rude, and the food came extremely late. We were there for hours just waiting on him. I remember we asked him for bread which is normally brought out for an appetizer and he literally told us, "We didn't need bread." Uhhh, excuse me? I told him literally 3 times to bring the bread and after several attempts and getting tired of waiting, the bread finally came out. Everyone at my table was restless. I complained for the horrible service I received and there was no redemption. The manager did nothing and looked at me as if it had been a joke. This experience totally ruined my birthday and I was extremely embarrassed to have brought my party.

The hubski and I visited Va Bene after reading some glowing reviews.
I love this place because its a haven for cougars as well as $10,000 millionaires. Lets face it, sometimes its fun to be a $10,000 millionaire.
We have been back many times, and every time are greeted by Sasha, the manager, and by our favorite waiters. Maybe this is because of the impression ( and 10 business cards) the hubski leaves everywhere he goes, or maybe everyone gets this treatment, but Va Bene is kind of like our Cheers now.
The place has great decor and magnificent food, but you can eat for as little as $11 or as much as $35 per plate. The tiramisu is out of this world, as is the tartufo. What, you may ask, is a tartufo? Picture this and be prepared to salivate (maybe have a tissue on hand). A tartufo is a scoop of sorbet, chocolate or raspberry, dipped in chocolate (dark, I think), re-frozen, sliced on a bed of fresh whipped cream, and drizzled with chocolate or raspberry syrup. Unbelievable.
I have ordered something different every time I go, and I never cease to be delighted. The first time was the most special though- the fish of the day. It was halibut on top of sauteed spinach and feta mashed potatoes. That's right. Feta. Indulgent.
Nice bar, great wine list. We'll be back soon.

Love this place.  1st time there last night.  Bar is so cozy.   Excellent food,  martinis and wine.  Service was amazing.  Sam best waitress.  The general manager checked on us several times.  You rarely see that these days.  Highly recommend this place.

This place is the BEST!  Great decor, great outside dining, true Italian feel to the place.  And then there is the FOOD!  WOW.  Visiting from Seattle and have eaten there twice and hope to go once more.  We have had the antipasto misto, Melanzane Ripieni, calamari, clams, mussels, spinach salad.  The clams in wine sauce were perfect!  The mussels were smaller than ours in the Northwest so I enjoyed them much more, they were in a sauce that is indescribable!  Your mouth falls in love!  The champagne vinaigrette on the spinach salad was obviously homemade and could never be duplicated, sad. And the calamari was excellent with a garlic mayonnaise.

The second time we were there we sat outside during happy hour and the place was completely packed and the wonderful staff managed to take care of all of us timely and friendly.

The happy hour is the type I like, half off of any appetizers, rather than offering a few shabby dishes at a discount.  

AMORE!!

If you want Real Italian   This is it. Great waiters. Great Italian Bread. Hugh wine selection. But the Best is the food. Great flavorful Italian dishes. Good portions. At fair reasonable price. 5 star

Wow, wow, wow, what a find.  There are so many Italian restaurants in the valley, I have to admit, I probably wouldn't have found Va Bene if it weren't for a causal search on Groupon one day.  I thought...sure I'll buy it, what's the harm in trying.  I live in the west valley so not exactly close by...but we happened to be passing through last night so we stopped to try it out.
We were early...around 5 or so.  The place was pretty empty and we were seated in the nice and quiet back room.  Our server (who I failed to remember his name but he was a friendly gentleman from Yugoslavia) was EXTREMELY nice and helpful.  He asked if we'd been before and we said no, so he was awesome in explaining dishes.  We had our children with us and they don't have a children's menu but they were more than willing to make something kid-friendly for them (although honestly my kids love everything and will eat most anything).  Our table ordered and highly enjoyed:
Pasta Siciliana
Pasta Bolognese
Shrimp with Curry Sauce-a unique twist that my husband enjoyed per our server's recommendation 
Alfredo (for the kiddies) 
Gnocchi alla Vodka-this was my dish and it was OUTSTANDING-probably some of the best gnocchi I've ever had.  I would drive across the valley again just for this dish.
I now know where to come when I am craving gnocchi...done right.
The bread and tomato-Basil butter is delicious, warm and fresh.  The starter salads were also very good, nice size portion.
We were stuffed but I had to try their 'one of a kind' espresso Creme Brûlée.  It is very unique-sweet.  I highly recommend it.
Service was fantastic....up until the end.  Took a little while to clear plates and bring the check but I won't fault them because by then it was 6:30 and they were getting busy.
This is a family owned spot and we had a wonderful meal.  I am already drooling when I think about eating that gnocchi again!!

Great service, great food & fabulous complimentary tiramisu for your birthday. We had 5 different dishes Salmone Va Bene ,lemon chicken, pasta w/ chicken, pasta w/ seafood, pasta w/ veggies, and everyone was happy. 

A nice quiet patio if you want to avoid the loud bar, but don't want the formal dining area.

My stand-by favorite Italian restaurant for years!

Looking at the menu, I was excited to try a non-chain Italian restaurant.
The atmosphere is elegant and quiet, and the wait staff attentive.  The restaurant is billed as a wine bar, but not one Malbec to be found.
We enjoyed our shrimp appetizer, and the Spinach salad was interesting and well dressed. Big disappointment with both entrees. The veal Marsala was pounded so thin, that it resembled jerky breaded when it made it to the table. For $25 dollars, Olive Garden does a better job.  The stuffed pork loin suffered from being dried out and virtually tasteless.  The cardinal sin on both entrees was frozen, bland vegetables straight out of the steamer.  The $95 bill was just a waste of money.  Chef needs to get out of the 1980's and come up with better selections and plate presentation.
Gnocchi was excellent and best spinach salad ever. Excellent meal. Only recommendation is to keep the red wine at appropriate temperature. We had a bottle of amarone and it was  warm.
All of the food ordered at my table was very tasty.  Overall, a very reliable hardy Italian food place.

came in on a Monday night for a date and sat in the "lounge" bar. It's open seating so we sat in a booth.

It's was pretty dead that night which was good in the since we could have our private time without loud crowds.

Service was good and our server took care of us.

We had the escargot as an app, with lamb shanks and veal for our entree. The food seemed average to me. It was good, but nothing that would blow me away. I'm be willing to come back to see what else they offer.

I love Italian food and no matter where I go I keep coming back to my favorite one. Va Bene is not only good but they also have a great selection of vinos.  Their arrabbiata sauce is to "die for". Try it with sausage over your favorite pasta. Don't forget the chianti.

The chicken and mushroom pasta and the espresso Creme brûlée  is TO DIE FOR! The service is fantastic and the prices are great! Was just there last week and have already planned our next date night w the wife for this weekend again!

One of the best places you will find in Arizona for great authentic Italian dishes.  Sunday and Monday they have happy hour 1/2 off appetizers all day long.  We've eaten there many times with family and friends and have yet to hear a single complaint.

I came here for shrimp rigatoni and got some brushetta as well. Shrimp Rigatoni was good but didn't fill me up but luckily the Brushetta did. Price was about $20 for both and staff was friendly. Overall not a bad spot but bigger portions would be better . Food quality is good and they do have a bar.

Great atmosphere and the waitstaff was friendly each time we've visited.  Actual Italians?  They seemed in the way like restauranteurs we experienced in Italy.  We loved their snails appetizer and our meals were well prepared.

Dazzling example of near-authentic Italian. "Near-authentic" because the only thing that keeps it from being authentic is a 12 hour flight to Firenze. Slide on over to LivingSocial, get a coupon, and run to Va Bene.

From the outside Va Bene looks like an every day Italian Restaurant. But once you go in it is fancy smancy! 

I have been to Va Bene a few times for different occasions and I continue to return for the Calamari alone! The absolute best Calamari I have found, and trust me I try the Calamari every where! 

Their food is good, I have also ordered the Fruiti Del Mar, which was a really great dish. My friend a year later still talks about the best steak he has ever had. 

I think Va Bene knows what they are doing and should continue to make its customers happy if they stick to their recipe for a great restaurant!

Va Bene's veal Marsala was the Best I've had since moving to Arizona. The service was excellent. My wife was not happy with her pork dish because it was different from the description in the menu; the management did NOT charge us for her meal. I highly recommend you try Va Bene.

So, I left a review for this place December of 2016.  

I am back to send myself (and any readers) a reminder why I love this hidden 24-year old Italian restaurant and bar.  Great each time.

I went on Tuesday January 9th with 3 buddies.  Good Call guys.

I have a hard time ordering since everything is delicious, and I want to everything on the menu.  Everyone ordered but me.  My friends have their go-to dishes already.  Sensing my frustration, the bartender Brett suggested I enjoy my known favorite: Chicken Piccata.  Served on small bed of craft mashed potatoes, I said maybe next time.  But the Picatta sauce:   butter, lemon juice, capers, with white wine was still calling my name.

The owner/manager Sasha was professionally eavesdropping and suggested I substitute salmon instead of chicken and place on bed of linguini instead of mashed potato. Hello. Wow, not on the menu, this was a home run! This should be on the menu all the time.  The salmon was flaky, perfect temp, and the linguini was the perfect texture.  

Only 1 problem ...there was sauce left-over in dish so I asked for a little more of their in-house fresh bread to soak up the butter, lemon, capers, white wine delight!  Problem is the bread is so good, you need to avoid eating it before, and in my case, after your meal.  It is that good.

Va Bene is truly va bene!

PS:  White Sauce or Red Sauce Mussels appetizer is an amazing happy hour item.  PSS:  Don't fill up on bread, though you can't help yourself.

The food was not very good. My pasta sauce tasted like it was from a can and the salmon was fishy tasting.  I only ate a very small amount.  My husbands dish of stuffed pork also was nothing to write home about. 
The salad and app and good--but that was it.  Also the band plays in the bar where we ate and the sound system is terrible.  You can't hear the music very good and certainly can't understand a word they say.  Overall this place wasn't very good and I would not waste my money to go back.

Took my wife out for her birthday.  She is a great lover of Calamari and orders it anywhere it might be available.  Unfortunately it was only average,  with a sparse dipping sauce sprinkled over it.  We've had better in many places.  I ordered a chicken piccata, she a stuffed pork loin which could have used more sauce.  Both the chicken and the pork were tough, but flavorful, with fresh veggies.  Service was average but slow.  The house wine was good and relatively inexpensive.  The best part of the evening was the discount through Groupon!  Our Creme Broule wasn't as good as we had hoped for.  I can only rate our total experience as 3 star.
Best ever of its kind the ambiance was nice the bisque was amazing as expected snd the mussels were Devine I love the house sauce they use i tasted it in both dishes

The greatest restaurant we've eaten at for our entire trip in Arizona. Very reasonably priced, outstanding service, and so happy with the experience! Our table also ordered the House Merlot which was one of our favorites ever tasted, and also completely reasonable. If you are looking for an amazing dining experience, this restaurant is a must! I cannot speak more highly of it!

This looks like a great place for a quiet date night meal.  We were there for a family meal, so the ambiance was somewhat wasted on us.  In any case, I had the seafood pizza and enjoyed it quite a bit.  It is nice to find something a little out of the ordinary on the menu.  I would like to try this place again.

As good as it gets in my opinion. This place is elegantly decorated with crimson red drapes and beautifully framed Picasso inspired paintings. Service was very immediate, attentive and professional throughout our entire meal.

I had a halibut special which was perfectly prepared in a light garlic butter sauce accompanied by very tasty mashed potatoes and freshly sautéed spinach.  My wife never passes up gnocchi made from scratch and Va Bene's did not disappoint her. Prepared in a light vodka sauce, the pasta dumplings were tender and light. 

The portions are generous and after a full size salad, I was unable to finish my entree but I did find room for their chocolate espresso creme brûlée which was absolutely killer great 

Va Bene was a terrific Yelp find that lived up to its many excellent reviews.

We came out here on the weekend to celebrate a birthday.  We did have 3 Groupons within the 6 if us and knew we were pushing it when asked to sit together as this was specified in the Groupon.  
The service was very pleasant and prompt.  We ordered the bruschetta and they also provided complimentary bread with a, sun dried tomato dip which was very nice. 
We ordered 2 of the gamberi pasta, 2 pork breaded cutlets, 1 veal masala and 1 chicken with asparagas.

All meals were nice but I can't say out of this world pretty simple family style serving with mash and vegetables with the meat.  

Will be back again with groupons:)

This is the place to go if you want a first-class dining experience from start to finish. Phoenix seems to have a dearth of quality Italian restaurants. This is the only one in the Valley I can think of that gets 5 stars. 

Service: outstanding. Our waiter was a consummate professional, i.e., not just a "friendly guy" but a gentleman who goes out of his way to make sure you know this is a top-notch restaurant. Without being snobby, of course. 

Atmosphere: up-scale Italian-American. 

Food: outstanding. The "Zuppa di Funghi", a mushroom soup, was out of this world. In perusing their website just now I'm surprised by the lower price of the main entrees, relative to their quality. It's still a bit pricey so I don't come here often. But it's perfect for special occasions and to satisfy an Italian craving.

Great food and drinks last evening to celebrate a friend's graduation.  The Antipasto Misto, Gamberoni con Prosciutto (fresh shrimp wrapped with basil and prosciutto), Melanzane Ripieni  (eggplant) were amazing.  Great Happy Hour pricing!  They have a great selection of wines (I enjoyed the J Lore Cabernet).  Great food and drink topped off by wonderful service.  One of the best restaurants in Ahwatukee.

We have gone to Va bene for work lunch and it has always been ok. Decided this time to go for dinner so I took my Girlfriend.

Right away, the service was great. We were seated fast and brought menus. We were told about the specials of the day and we ordered appetizers quickly.

I order the Linguine Fruitti Del mar, and my girlfriend had the pesto linguine. We ordered the clams as an appetizer.

The clams came out and were great. The garlic broth smothering the clams were super tasty and the bread was crispy and great for dunking. The portion is really small, I counted 6 clams and 2 of them were empty. I swished my fork in the broth to see if they fell out, but they were never there.

The main course was pretty bad. The pesto had virtually no Basil taste and if you closed your eyes, you would not have guesses any basil was used. We tried it with our eyes closed and it tasted almost fettuccine -like. My Del Mar was super bland as well. It tasted like canned tomato paste. The Mussels were tough and chewy and not enjoyable. The calamari looked like noodles and had no taste. They were mushy and seemed to be over soaked or over-boiled. The crushed Red Pepper helped to spice up the dish, but didn't really help mask the overall blandness.

I gave this 3 stars cause the service was prompt and the owner (I think) came out a few times to check up on us. The bill was appropriate for a two person dinner (roughly $50). The food was the only disappointment. I will give this place another try and hope that our next visit is more tasty.

I love this place. Not a chain so they can go above and beyond for you. They have an awesome patio that has a fire pit and comfortable seating. The food is great as well. Try the mussels and the gnocchi. If you sit at the bar you will most likely get Michelle on a Monday or Tuesday. She is super welcoming and as I said before, goes above and beyond to make you the drink you want. And the bar is HUGE!!! I suggest anyone that like good Italian food try it!!

Great Atmosphere, Good Food, Not The Most Attentive Service...

So to start things out with the most positive... This is an nice little spot hidden just off the main roads but quite possibly overlooked. 

The atmosphere is clean and inviting with a nice dimly lit environment that prepares you for a relaxing meal. 

We found this place in Groupon where there was a $40 gift certificate for only $20 which makes trying a place out motivational!

We arrived and were promptly seated in the back room in the corner. I came to the conclusion that the staff doesn't notice you often in the corner....

Water is refilled at half cup by the roaming water fillers... 

The food was a solid enjoyable 4 of 5 stars... it was tasty and good, but not an explosion of greatness... definitely worth the price and the visit. 

Ordering desert requires more than 10 minutes of watching the waiter visit each table but ours as I waved and attempted to gain his attention.... finally he came ask we asked for the dessert menu but here is no actual menu so he verbally gave it to us... We ordered two desserts and coffee to end the night.

Getting coffee wasn't easy... the desserts came out and still no coffee. After a bit the waiter said he was making some coffee for us and then it arrived. Then we had to wait for real sugar since they brought a tray of chemical sugar substitutes that we wouldn't use...

Finally the coffee arrived and we drank it... nobody brought us refills of the coffee so we paid and left....
Calamari was tasty and the portion was very large.  I ordered the linguini pomodoro and added calamari and clams and it was delicious!  Drinks were huge for $5.00 each!  Highly recommend.

I cannot say enough good things about this place, just GO! Service is excellent, food is ALWAYS top notch. I've had nearly everything on the menu. I'm very picky with my food and all the dishes rates 'above average' up to 'stellar'! 

Seafood soup is very good and the mushroom soup is one of the best I've ever had, period. The Insalata con Rucola  comes with the raspberry vinaigrette but I recommend the champagne dressing on any salad as it is amazing. My favorite "normal" dish is the Pollo alla Genovese.

Go and enjoy!

Our first time here, came with a Groupon. I must say we were extremely pleased. Service was excellent, prompt and the food... beyond belief.  We started with Calamari Fritti and Cozze Tarragon (mussel) appetizers.  Sweet and not overpowering tarragon, it was so good I wanted to have a double portion...  The calamari was tender with a garlic mayonaise sauce.  Equally good. And portion size? They don't stint. At all.  Did I make you hungry? Good!!  Come and explore the menu; I won't bore you with the rest of our lunch but be assured,  we weren't disappointed.

Had the pleasure of dining here last evening on clelbration of my wife's birthday.  Food was fabulous..try the veal dishes (Marsala and Picatta) and the Mushroom Soup (Zuppa di Fungi) peppery and just the right amount of spice.  Reminds us of dining in Providence , RI.  Service was great, Boris, our waiter was most attentive and helpful in making our menu choices.  Nice romantic atmosphere, white table cloths, the works.

Now why I rated with 4 stars and not 5 to no fault of the restaurant or staff.  

The table next to us was a different story and almost ruined a nice romantic dinner.  The couple get seated, a middle-aged couple, (he was wearing a ball cap and once removed the was balding) guessing both in their early 50's. Then they both start on their mobile phones..ugh. Not once did they stop..searching the web, making calls, receiving calls, etc. HOW DAMN RUDE. Plus it was obvious they had a GroupOn for $40 and tried to stay in that limit and order food to go. When the food came he (Mr. Bald Cap) bitched at his wife for ordering the food. Well if he was off his phone long enough he could have figured out what she ordered. GEEZ. The meal continued both on their phones. So I requested the bill and even commented to the Boris the waiter how rude they were and he said that was normal behavior today...NOT ACCEPTABLE PEOPLE. I thought this ugly, rude behavior was limited to our Millenials (our children) BUT NO it is now so prevalent in our older society it is out of control.

Bottom line of the review...do to Va Bene and enjoy a nice meal with great service and tell the people next to you to turn off their DAMN phones for an hour.

I enjoyed the place. We didn't have as attentive of a server as I would have liked, but the food was excellent. I had the Risotto  mare Monte while my friend had the Linguine al Pesto. Both tasted delicious, flavorful, and absolutely fantastic. 
The atmosphere was relaxed and more high-end. Recommended.
Just had a wonderful lunch here!  Everything was beautiful, the food, the ambiance and the service!  We had the steak salad and seafood pizza, simply delicious!  Great prices too!  We will be back!

Went there last night.   Definitely good food.   The server, Srdjan, was a bit on the "stuffy" side, but I suppose that's his personality.   Gets the job done and is competent and efficient.   I asked his opinion about the wine.    He suggested the J Lohr, which suited my palate exactly.  Had the calamari fritti as an appetizer.  It was good.   Not great but good.   We ordered the linguine vongole and the linguine fruitti mare.   I had the linguine fruitti mare.  Since I am not a tomato sauce fan, I talked to Srdjan about it, and he asked if I would like it changed to a white sauce, which I did.   I was great!!   Had quite a bit of shell fish.  The pasta was cooked to perfect and flavored just the way I like it.    My table mate had the linguine vongole, and I was told it was very tasty as well, absolutely no complaints.    Would I go back?   Definitely .  The food and atmosphere is great.

What a joke me and my wife went in for a late dinner the bar bar was full so we went to the dining room . Waited about ten minutes servers bussers and hostesses passed by us so we decided to walk out . On our way out we bump into the manager let him know what happened his response was sorry and he continued on is way .

Dined here tonight. We arrived around 4 and had a reservation (read some Yelp reviews that it's a must!). Though the dining area was empty when we arrived. After half an hour, a couple more tables started coming. Our waiter, who was pleasant I must say, greeted us and started telling us about their daily special - which I didn't fully grasp (too hungry to listen). We stuck with the regular menu and ordered the Caprese Salad, Prosciutto with Melon, Chicken Pesto Pizza and Chicken and Mushroom Pasta. Waiter said they are out of Prosciutto with Melon so I opted for Beef Carpaccio instead. Food was delivered after about 15 minutes of waiting. Beforehand, the waitstaff gave us complimentary  bread and butter to munch on. Our bread was a bit burnt.  Nevertheless the water was filtered and doesn't have that tap taste. Anyway, food arrived and everything tasted decent. Nothing really popped out, nothing was too exquisite for me to have the urge to go back soon. Since we have a bit of room for dessert, we opted to try their Tiramisu. We ended up wishing we hadn't. I expected that dessert would really be savory and delectable since it is from a restaurant, but I seriously had better ones from the frozen aisles in grocery stores. Meh, maybe it's just me. Then again, I wasn't the only one who didn't find it spectacular. Nevertheless, I think I'll be back. My experience wasn't horrible, it just wasn't spectacular. 

All in all, ambiance is romantic and intimate. Food is so-so. Service is decent. Solid 3 stars!

I took my daughter and her boyfriend to Va Bene for dinner on Easter. I would have taken them to a nice brunch but they both had to work until 4 o'clock. I read some great reviews and I read some horrific reviews so I decided to come up with my own opinion. We were created promptly by the waiter who seemed as though we were a bother more than a customer. The food runner and busboy were on point they were pleasant. We ordered an appetizer the calamari it was different it was thin rings with a sauce which was very good. It was odd that the waiter took our appetizer and food order together. My daughter and her boyfriend both ordered the pasta with vodka sauce and I ordered the veal Picatta. 
The pasta was a hit and so was the veal though both portions were very small. The veal was $25.95 and in my 38 years of going out for dinner I never paid that much for so little. The meal was served with mashed potatoes set on the plate with an ice cream scoop and the vegetables were under cooked. I can honestly say this was the first time I left a restaurant hungry. 
To finish the meal I ordered the cheese cake if it was made with ricotta cheese the waiter informed me he was not sure how it was made let me check the box. Really check the box even if it did come in a box don't say it. I informed if it is not ricotta cheese I will have the cream brûlée. Well the food runner brought out the cream brûlée. We never asked if we wanted coffee. The decor reminded me of the Italian restaurants in Chicago in the old Italian neighborhoods not for the food quality and portions but the decor. 
Just a note to the owners don't cut the veal paper thin skip the mashed potatoes and offer a side of pasta and make sure the vegetables are cooked.

Great food at reasonable prices. We enjoyed a bottle of wine and great offering of apprizers which the lady and I shared. Thankful we found this little gem in Chandler. The staff was amazing and attentive even though you could tell a large party departed before us. They still accommodated us even after we arrive close to closing time.

Service - excellent! The host was friendly, our server was awesome, gave me great suggestions - i love love love the bread + butter, mussels appetizer.

Food - Portion was great, not too big, the pasta was perfectly cooked (I requested mine to be al dente) i like mine to be spicy so I requested for red crushed chili pepper. SO GOOD!

Overall, was such a great experience, wish my stay in Phoenix was longer. Will definitely going back to this restaurant next time I am in town.

Service - not good.  Food - even worse.  Ambiance for 3 girls celebrating a birthday on a Friday night - yuck.  Long story short - not recommended.

*side note: This review is based on a happy hour experience.  Maybe, just maybe, dining on the other side of the restaurant would have resulted in a better review.
Great food, wonderful ambience, and nice owners! I'm even using them for the company holiday lunch!

Tried Va bene after eyeballing it on Groupon for quite a while. A few days before dinner I called and made a reservation; upon arrival we had to wait. The restaurant is kind of a yin and yang situation; one side is a full loud bar with TVs blaring sports and the other half is the dining area. The tables in the dining room are pretty close and the atmosphere is very loud and chaotic, not relaxing and romantic as I'd hoped.

At first our server seemed really icy and rude but throughout the night he became much more personable. Food wait times were bordering the "I'm getting very hangry" point. While the portions were VERY generous, the food was just very average to me. Not bad, not great. I think that on a slower night things could be better; I just don't live close enough to make that gamble.

Great happy hour!

$5 for house wine
appetizers are all half off with the exception of one. I would say the calamari is the best bang for your buck.  You get literally a giant mount and its pretty delicious. I also love the carpaccio.  Very simple but really good. I always find myself wanting to order another plate. the only thing that I didn't enjoy was the escargot. it came wrapped up in a puff pastry with a creamy sauce inside but the puff pastry was very underdone so it was basically still raw on the inside which made for an even chewier experience then the snail itself. but overall I like this place and would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting to grab a few appetizers and brings.  

Haven't tried the dinner menu so I can't comment on how their main courses are.

I'm in Phoenix on business and visited this place after my boss raved about it...I sat at the bar which is very spacious; a long triangle of black marble, ringed by a number of small tables and booths. Nice decor, dark and relaxing atmosphere. I ordered some bruchetta and ordered the rigatoni bolognese while watching some ESPN. The place looks pretty upscale.. Fast service, good food, nice digs. $24 for the appetizer, meal and 2 Heinees. Not bad. I'll be back next time I'm in town...
Oh yeah, my boss asked me to look out for this beauty named 'Shannon' at the bar...no luck.

For being an Italian restaurant, they sure do have amazing steak! Every time I come here I order the bacon wrapped filet mignon, it is one of the best steaks I've ever had! Our waiters have always been fantastic, and even though they don't always offer that specific dish, they will usually make it for me anyways. I love that it's quiet and romantic, and it can be casual or formal. Great bar area as well, we really love this place.

My husband and I selected Va Bene for our wedding reception. We were having a small wedding, 40 people, and had heard Va Bene was an excellent restaurant.

The wait staff and food was delicious. We could have not have asked for better service or food for our reception. People complemented the service and food - for that I would have given 5 stars...

However, I took a couple of stars off due to the manager Donna and lack of communication. We originally started talking back in November over email as we live in NYC. It was easy enough to book and she provided us with a simple menu which we were pleased with. I emailed her to ask to meet with her in February as I was flying out to finalize things before the April wedding. She agreed (we did have to change the date since my flight was cancelled and rescheduled, but she agreed to meet me at the same time the following day). When I arrived Donna was not there - they had no idea that I was coming or when Donna would be in. We waited for a half an hour before Sasha helped us - I was ready to change the venue. Sasha was helpful and nice and offered a food tasting during the week. We came back for the food tasting and Donna met us - although she acted as though she couldn't be bothered with us. Michele, another manager from my understanding, took care of us.  Without Sasha or Michele I would have changed the venue. 

Donna was also very hard after that to get in contact with. She took up to a week to respond to us, and the only time we really got any information was when Michele took over the emailing while Donna was on vacation. Additionally, Donna forgot to inform Michele that my husband would be by the day of the wedding to drop things off - we agreed at 3:30 so the room would be ready. When he arrived nothing was set up...

In the end, the food, wait staff, Michele and Sasha were wonderful. I would eat there again, however, I would shy away from arranging another big event.

A mixed bag.  The melons in the melon and prosciutto appetizer were the crunchiest I've ever eaten, the mozzarella was so-so, and the pasta was cooked past al dente.  There were some nice individual flavors, with the chicken and artichoke in a dijon sauce being quite tasty, but no dish we ordered really came together well.  Also, the service, while friendly and gracious (they comped us a glass of wine to make up for its slow delivery), went through a rough patch during our visit. Our water glasses were not refilled, dirty plates remained on the table for 20 minutes after our meal was finished, and the waitress brainfarted our creme brûlée order out of existence.  Which is ok - we didn't need dessert, but we did kinda want it :).

Hosted a party of 10 people for my husband's birthday and was very pleased with the food, service, and ambiance. My husband is 2nd generation Italian and he grew up with his great grandmother making gnocchi every Sunday duing the winter time. So of course he had to order the gnocchi! The verdict? Rediculously good and some of the best since his grandmother's! I ordered the linguini puttanesca with a glass of white wine and they were just as delicious. We will definitely be returning soon!

Great place. Ate snails for the first time, shared different apps with some friends and hung out on their clean and ultra sleek patio. The general manager was super nice and personally came out to check on us several times throughout our visit. Great happy hour with reasonable prices and perfect top shelf martinis.

This restaurant has a wonderful atmosphere and gives the impression that it's fine dining, however it was very mediocre.

Our waiter walked away from us while we were ordering our drinks and said "hold on" before coming back, which was rude. 

We ordered the clams and they were so salty they were inedible and i can handle salt. The waiter gave us an excuse about where the clams come from and that's why they're salty. After saying we didn't want them, he awkwardly offered the mussels which we accepted. They were over cooked and cold. The white wine broth tasted like water.

I ordered the ribeye and orzo Risotto that was on their specials. The steak was cooked correctly but I don't believe it was a ribeye cut because it tasted like a steak from Marie Calendars and despite looking pink and delicious it was still somehow tough and chewy. The risotto was very good though.

All in all the food is way over priced for the quality. I would not come back here.

I ordered delivery from Va Bene thru Doordash.  I got the fettuccine with clams, mussels, scallops and shrimp.  I also ordered the appetizer Melanzane Ripieni which is eggplant stuffed with squash and ricotta and WOW.  I've never seen this item on a menu before, and since I'm adventurous, I decided to give it a shot and now it's my favorite thing ever.  I'll have to try out my cooking skills with this one.  Anyway, TONS of seafood in the Frutti di Mer and the sauce was delish.  Next time I order I might ask for an extra side of marinara. Also, I got the Pasta E Fagioli because I always order that when it's on a menu and that too was so yummy.  This place really feels like the italian restaurants I miss from back east.
Great service, nice atmosphere. I had the gnocchi and it was heavenly. The tiramisu tastes homemade. Definitely an authentic Italian experience, will be going back again.

Quiet exquisite atmosphere! Will definitely recommend to colleagues and friends!
Escargots! Great experience!

The eggplant appetizer was delicious as was the rest of our food. A+ rigatoni. Cooked to perfection. The service was great and the food is superb. Going to recommend this restaurant to everyone at work!
Food was good, not spectacular. Service was fair. Had to ask for utensils no fresh cracked pepper or cheese. Have had better.

My book club met there for Happy Hour last month and if my review was based solely on that experience, I would've given 4 stars. Great lounge with ample seating, good music (loud, but not too loud, we had no problem hearing each other speak across a table of 6) and GREAT PRICES. I had 3 glasses of Chianti, the grilled veggies and the little-neck clams (with plenty of bread to sop up the delicious buttery wine sauce) and the check was just $25! Holy bargains Batman!

Unfortunately, my recent Friday night visit (6:45 - 9pm) did not leave me so giddy...
There was no room in the main dining room and since this was Date Night with the hubby (as opposed to Fire Sale at The Local Meat Market) we opted for the "quiet side of the patio" out front. Unlike the inside, VB's front patio has ZERO ambience. And with no twinkle lights or even a faint stream of music, the view of the parking lot reinforces thoughts of hopping in the car and heading elsewhere...
As far as the food goes, it started off GREAT. The scallops appetizer was nothing short of perfect (my husband concurs)--sauteed in a pesto and SO juicy. The side of greens was an ideal accompaniment, with a light vinaigrette. The entrees, on the other hand, were so disappointing... The veal marsala was meh: while it was tender enough to cut with a fork, the sauce was very generic, almost tasted like brown gravy, which is exactly what ny husband said about the sauce on his ahi tuna dish. As far as the sides of potatoes & veggies that came with the meals--on par with your average cafeteria, and unfortunately, there was no salt nor pepper on the table to remedy the absolute blandness. By the time the waitress got back to our table, I had decided not to bother requesting seasonings, as they were already cold.
The dessert (chocolate cheesecake) was passable, but tasted prepackaged.
As far as the service, she seemed a bit overwhelmed and unencouraging with regard to our food choices...
Although we used a Groupon and therefore paid almost half of what the bill would've normally been, we were still underwhelmed.
Had the seafood pasta.  Seafood was a little better than an average restaurant and the pasta noodles were way too soft (waiter said would be al dente).  Wouldnt go back.

Va bene is such a great place to have drinks or dinner. The staff is so so friendly! The manager, Rick, I always so welcoming. The bartenders and staff are equally as friendly and so attentive. I recommend the pasta...it's all so delicious. When I've gone in I've noticed a lot of familiar faces so they get a lot of regulars and I think that speaks highly of the restaurant.

I was super impressed with this establishment. To begin with, our waiter had an Italian accent. Not sure if it was legit or not, but it added to the ambience and experience of our meal. The waiter asked if we were interested in hearing about the specials. I decided to order the filet mignon special.
The wait for our food was a long one. They did keep our drinks full, and the bread basket and butter held us over.
The filet was melt in your mouth. Absolutely delicious! It was not over cooked, rather, it had just the right amount of pink. The sauce was divine. The green beans were very fresh and quite delicious as well. The mashed potatoes weren't great, nothing to brag about.
After our meal. The waiter asked if we would be having dessert. Uh, duh! I was torn between the Creme brûlée and cheesecake. I decided to go for the Creme brûlée. It was definitely over carmelized and had to scoot most of the over charred to the side.
Overall, a wonderful dining experience. Intimate ambience and wonderful service.

Happy hour here is amazing; half price appetizers, and good deals on yummy drinks. My favorite appetizer was the calamari-which was probably the best I've ever had. They also bring out complementary hot fresh baked bread-served with sun-dried tomatoes herb butter. SO GOOD! We ordered many other appetizers and drinks throughout the evening and all were delicious. I cannot wait to come back to try entrees and deserts.

Went here on a Groupon and the customer service in the bar and main dining room is outstanding.  That being said the food is an Italian find.
The happy hour is very reasonable $5.00 clams yummy all the appetizers except 1 is 1/2 price.

Sergio in the dining room is wonderful and is very patient at I asked  a lot
of questions on all the entries.  He offered a parmesan chicken that was not on the menu with fetachini it was delicious  and the gnocchi was knock it out the park.  Husband had the Linguine Frutti di Mare and was bowled over with the flavors, amount of fish, etc.

Highly recommend.

What a great experience! The lounge is great for happy hour and they serve the best pineapple martinis. Randy at the bar is perfection. We have an Airbnb minutes away and have put it in our guide book because this place is so amazing. We live in San Diego but coming here is one of our favorite things about Phoenix!

Classy as can be, but casual at the same time. Wonderful happy hour with half price appys and drink specials. Pretty much every appy is amazing. Fun friendly bartenders too! Will come again and again.

My wife & I have dinned at Va Bene off & on for 4 years. When we want clams we either go there or to the Salt Cellar in Scottsdale. Yesterday ( mothers day), I phoned Va Bene ahead of time  to make sure they would accept groupon before I went online to buy it. The young lady on the phone said yes, so I purchased it.
My wife and I are in our 60's and enjoy eating at the bar. When we tried to order clams the bartender said they were out of clams. It was around 5 pm. For a Italian restaurant not to have clams is like a ice cream parlor that doesn't offer ice cream but there were other food options we entertained. After spending $75 for 4 drinks & food we presented our groupon & credit card for payment only to have a lady by the name of Donna flat get in our face and told us she wasn't allowing us to use the groupon. No apologizes, just total rudeness. She was extremely indignant & unprofessional, enough for our bartender to be embarrassed. My wife & I felt very insulted by this person and from now on we will dine at the other restaurant that offers excellent service & always has clams. Last but not least, after buying the groupon I found an older one that we had't used that indicates "never expires". Donna indicated she would never honor that one as well.

Paid for the Groupon, also used a 20%off coupon so I paid $20 for $40 worth of food. Unbelievable price to try something new! This is an authentic Italian spot with real Italian waiters and cooks. The smell of the restaurant made my stomach growl and mouth water. Remember to dress nicely when coming here, I felt under-dressed wearing khakis. A candle lit dinner was nice but my table was unstable and wobbly. The waiter was hardly checking up on us, it felt like he had better places to be. We ordered the chicken mushroom dish and it was spectacular. Also ordered creme brûlée and it was very delicious but they burnt the sugar on top  too much so it became very bitter... Food: 5 stars 
Service: 2  If I come back, it'll mainly be to try another dish.

I was talked into going here by my wife who had been previously. I was somewhat skeptical having had a favorite Italian restaurant for many years that just recently closed. What a pleasant surprise! This place feels like the family restaurant that it is. It's not a corporate debacle. 
Great band, comfortable seating, very attentive staff. It seems like we got there at the right time because seating wasn't an issue and the drinks showed up right away. If you're looking for a place you can walk into and be immediately comfortable I recommend this.

Oh how I love great Italian...let me count the ways. Great pasta, super satisfying calamari, nice selection of California wines and imports (by the glass). The ambiance is refined, relaxed and modern. I simply cannot wait to return here - especially after the no smoking law goes into effect at the bar. Friendly staff, great service, delicious food. In the 'burbs and worth it.

Stopped in for an early Mother's day dinner this afternoon in the dining room and was quite pleased with the experience at Va Bene.

The waitstaff was excellent, we didn't have to wave anyone down when our glasses started to look a little low, the bread basket was always full (and their tomato basil butter was delicious, too!)

It was a little pricey, but the food quality was certainly worth the price paid, imo.  I would certainly recommend Va Bene for anyone that would like an attainable, upscale Italian dinner or lunch.

k...  Here is the deal.  I would give this place a 5 if I had never had east coast italian.  Fot italian food anywhere I think this is a great place though. Really cool decor. Loved the bar. Our bartender Frank was a really cool guy.  

The fact that this place is a cougar heaven makes it extra cool (Cougars need lovin too!)

I think the best italian I have had in phoenix.  Had a spinach salad and bruschetta which was SO good.  Bruschetta was one of the best I have had anywhere.

Had a Sausage and peppers in a red Cream Sauce.  Very very tasty.  Food was way better than I thought it would be.  

Just might go for happy hour today because I am cravin the itailian and the cougar atmosphere is a good one.

My husband and I tried this restaurant last night on recommendations from a friend. It was a Tuesday night around 7:30, and we were dressed casually, so when the hostess told us we could sit in the bar area (which is very large) we opted for that. Probably not the best choice, because as the night went on the music got louder. 
We found their wine list adequate and ordered a lovely bottle of Valley of the Moon sangiovese. That was probably the best thing we had all night, sadly. Our server was lovely, I must say. Very charming and upbeat. We ordered the calamari appetizer to share, which was pretty good. The batter and sauce were tasty, the squid a little chewy. But I liked that it came with a salad of romaine and tomatoes on the side. Good combination! Then came the entrees..I had the Veal Marsala and my husband ordered the New York Steak medium rare. The Veal was good and tender, but the mushroom sauce tasted like it came right out of a can. My husbands steak was cooked medium well, not rare, which he was very grumpy about. And the veggies they served along side were cold and hard and obviously frozen. One more chance: dessert. We ordered a tiramisu to share...on the recommendation of our server....and it was very ordinary, and tasted like it came from a grocery store. 
I have heard this place does have a great happy hour and I saw they did grey goose martinis (my favorite) If we were ever to return, I wouldn't mind trying those! And probably munch on the calamari....and forget the rest of the food.
I'd give the food a 3/5 and the actual restaurant a 5/5. The food was really just okay, but this place looks GREAT!
Great food and nice atmosphere. Service was good and prompt. Definitely would come back.
Really like this place. The food is great.  I love the mussels. Bartender very good. Good place to meet up with a friend like I did.

Great Happy Hour! Appetizers half price except prosciutto wrapped shrimp. The Calamari Fritti is soooo good and is served with salad so you can make a salad or eat each separately! The Melanzane Ripieni (eggplant and squash-both I love) was good, but extremely cheesy (which many will like!) Good drink prices for happy hour and a nice fire pit table outside if you want to attempt it in the winter :) I will be back!

3.5 stars.  Very nice "upper-crust" Italian place.  Pastas were typically $12-15 and Special entrees were typically $15-$30.  I visited on a Thursday night, no waiting, and few people there.  Very nice, comfy decor with red velvet drapes, dim lighting, white table-cloths, and picasso-like paintings all around.  Service was ok...the water-boy was good, but the waiter sporadically came by my table...always a bit late, and two waiters actually waited on me.  The menu had too much cream and pink sauce for me.   No whole wheat pastas.  One waiter actually helped me design my own meal which was nice.  I asked for a small side of arrabbiata  sauce expecting a hot red sauce, but made a cheesy, creamy mushroom sauce for me instead.  The complimentary bread was a bit stale and came with a cheesy stiff buttery kinda sauce...I had to ask for olive oil and balsamic vinegar.  They have a dining room and a separate lounge with a live jazzy band.  I think there's a private conference room too.
We had out of town friends that we took to dinner. We all enjoyed the atmosphere, the service and the food! We have been to Va Bene numerous times and we were not disappointed at all!

VERY DISAPPOINTED. We were excited to come here after reading the great Yelp reviews but wow were they misleading. The food is good but it took over an hour to get when everyone around us that got there after us got their food first. Our waiter straight up ignored us and wouldn't come to see us or the people sitting near us. When we asked for him to come see us they sent someone else and they made an excuse how a big party ordered before us. Well, that is understandable but it was not understandable that other people that ordered the same thing got it before us. Pasta does not take 1.5 hours to make. Also, once we finally found our waiter he smelt of strong cigarette smoke and it was obvious that he was outside smoking the whole time we were not being helped. I do want to mention the guys that fill the water and bring the bread were nice! They should be the waiters you guys have and fire your current waiters! We won't be back.

You've heard the expression, "you only have one chance to make a good impression", right?  Hmmmmm...hold that thought.

I saw Va Bene reviewed on PBS Arizona's, "Check Please". It's not at all convenient to where I live so I waited until I was "near" and decided to try it. (I was "near" all right: still took 25 minutes on I-10 to go from the 60 to Chandler Blvd).

I walked in and the place was hopping!  The bartender, alone, was crushed, waaaaaay too much bar for one person, yet she was friendly and efficient.

I asked The Guy In The Black Suit about appetizers and he assured me the right pick would be the mussels with marinara, Italian sausage, peppers and onions ("Cozi Va Bene"). It came out in good time, the marinara was amateurish. 

Before I filled up on bread, I ordered the Chicken Marsala and 35 (!) minutes later, I complained, it got fired right away and delivered- and it was not acceptable.  Not cooked. Problem in the kitchen. 

The Guy In The Black Suit comp'd my drinks and the uneaten entree but he couldn't comp the disappointment. Consider the gap between a TV exhibition so impressive that I made the effort to try a restaurant on a night bursting at the seams under the weight of too few staffed employees. 

Though this restaurant was WAS out of my way, I've got no problem driving a distance  for a great meal. This experience was a complete and utter failure and, no, I won't be back. For any reason.  Enjoy the exposure from the PBS spot. Waste of my time.

My family and I ate here early on a Friday evening without reservations.  We were seated immediately.  I liked the ambiance very much but felt the food did not live up to the upscale atmosphere.  We would have been happier at any number of chain Italian restaurants that do not make their food from scratch.

I had the cream of mushroom soup that tasted like Campbell's, fortunalty... I like Campbells.  I asked the waiter if the pasta was made fresh... NO.  So I ordered the one item that is made fresh... the gnocchi.  It was very mushy like paste and the sauce tasted like it came from a can.  We also tried the pesto pasta which was meh.  We did not finish any of our pasta courses.  We skipped the main course and went straight to the dessert.  Once again, I ordered the only thing made fresh in house which was the cream brûlée.  It was from the fridge... cold in the center and also meh.  The other dessert we tried was the chocolate cheese cake, not made on the premises, which was good.

Took wife to Va Bene for her birthday. There were 4 of us, We started with Bruschetta "Va Bene" and Antipasto Misto. Wife had the Filet Medallions and they were wonderful. I had the Gnocchi alla Vodka and I will have it again. We paired dinner with a nice Chianti. Food and wine was wonderful.

Only negative was in desert. I had Creme Brulee which was served cold so the top was nor as crispy as it should have been.

We will go again both for the restaurant and the bar.

Our first time there and it was great! Nice atmosphere! Food was delicious and service was wonderful! Staff was very attentive and totally worked as a team! The general manager came by and checked on us and introduced himself, really cannot say enough about the service! We will definitely be going back!

Been coming here for many, many, many years.  I believe reviews should be based on several experiences and NEVER judged on one excellent or poor experience.  For my family Va Bene has always been very consistent.  Absolutely fabulous Italian food with both the standard menu items along with insanely great specialty dishes.  Not much more I can add as pretty simple place to review.

Read the reviews and was not disappointed. Food, service and ambiance were all excellent.
Beer was cold and the pricing was ok. 
Looking forward to the next visit

The food here is really good! They have amazing happy hour deals too. The downside to that is you'll be surrounded by an older crowd. Diners beware: You might end up on a Cougars plate. Our waiter was really nice, friendly, and attentive. I had the Fettuccine Con Pollo & Fungi which was awesome!! Their bread is pretty tasty too! Will be coming back!
I love their happy hour! Killer martinis!

The food is good.  The service is spotty.  The happy hour deals are good and the atmosphere in the bar area is great for happy hour. Stick to the pasta dishes as the higher end entrees aren't anything specatular.

My husband and I wanted to celebrate our anniversary somewhere special because we've had an extremely difficult year and we needed a cause for celebration.  We had one of our first dates at Va Bene and loved it so much (the only time I would have given it five stars, but that was a long time ago) that we booked the restaurant for our wedding reception.  As most brides, I don't remember much of the reception, but I was surprised to hear bad feedback several weeks after the wedding about the restaurant/reception/dinner from our guests (including my matron of honor who recommended the restaurant to us initially for our date)...so maybe they don't do wedding receptions well..I cut them some slack.  We decided to give them another try for our first anniversary and the food was awful, but the service was worse.  We left so disappointed that we didn't return until last night (many years later) at my husband's suggestion (he wanted a romantic evening).  After reading the great yelp reviews, I thought they had recovered their mojo, but they did not.  We arrived in time for our 7pm reservation, of which they did not have a record...and the hostess didn't apologize, but blamed their systems.  They were practically empty, so they had plenty of room and instead, seated us against the far wall near the kitchen entrance and a large loud table.  I mentioned to the hostess and again to our server that we were celebrating our anniversary.  The server never asked us if we wanted drinks (but we had plenty of water).  One would think that for restaurant that promotes itself as a martini and wine bar, the server would ask about drinks.  If he had asked, we may have purchased their most expensive champagne, but he never asked, never gave us a wine list and he hurried us through a cocktail-less meal.  The calamari appetizer, while huge (because it was served with a salad) was frozen.  I ordered the Va Bene salad and it was soggy. My husband ordered the linguini with seafood and it was salty and my fish (the special) was bland, the spinach was overcooked and the potatoes were undercooked.  The best thing we had was their butter for our bread. Our server did bring us a slice of cheesecake to celebrate our anniversary (I was expecting Italian style cheesecake, but it was the heavy cream NY style cheesecake...it tasted fine, but just not what I expected), but he never asked us if we wanted coffee, tea, after dinner drinks or a different dessert.  I looked around at all the other tables and they had wine, beer, coffee and tea. So I thought, "what about our faces said we are in a hurry to get home"?  Our date night was an hour long and really, really disappointing.  We were hurried out of an empty restaurant at 8pm.  We will not be returning for any future anniversaries.  Three strikes and Va Bene, you are out!  Our marriage on the other hand, will survive this less than ideal anniversary dinner and we will celebrate next year at an establishment that considers an anniversary special.

I always liked the food here. Their salmon was awesome. Their prime rib was tasty as hell. I tried their lamb shanks which were alright. I had better lamb shanks at Byblos for sure. They have good wine choice and their ambience is good.
Great Italian style restaurant.  They have a cool bar and patio section.  They have live music some nights.  Cool spot.

The service was good and the food was excellent.  

This was our second time to this restaurant, the first time for a family event of 8 as we used a gift card  with many restaurants options.  We did use the second of our 4 'card/coupons' this evening for Va Bene.  Both experiences were excellent. 

Certificate or not, excellent food and service.

Va Bene is one of the best places in chandler! I love the atmosphere, drinks, and the manager Sasha Perric was nothing but accommodating and friendly! I will certainly be back with my friends and family. Thank you Va Bene and Sasha :)

Very disappointed in this place. I got the filet mignon for $40 and it literally had no taste to it. On top of that it was the special of the night. It was one of the worst filet mignon I have ever had. I don't like to give 2 stars, but that's how bad it was. Not only would I not suggest this place to anyone else, but will never be going back; very disappointed.

Vabenne is one of the best if not the best Italian restaurants in Arizona. My favorites are the tarragon mussels, Cesar salad and the Pollo Con Fungi (Chicken Fettuccine with mushrooms)! Everything you could ask for in an Italian meal! Sooooo good! Happy hour in the bar is the way to go as it cuts your bill in half and you can watch a game on the Ty's or hear live music on Friday nights.

My husband and I love coming here for Happy Hour,  especially when it's just before sunset! They have a really nice seating area outside with a fire pit with surround seating! We love the calamari con misto, prosciutto con melon, prosecco, chicken picatta, fettuccine alfredo, tonight I tried risotto with shrimp and mushrooms and it was amazingly good! They also have amazing chicken pesto pizza and tiramisu! Their lemon drop Martini is delish!

Management has changed and it shows and not in a good way.  We were there for 4 hours and should have been out in 2.5.  The service is horrendous - aside from being slow, they are not the friendliest folks in the world.  Instead of having 2-3 hostesses sitting at the front desk twiddling their thumbs, put them to work and have them refill waters and clear tables because the wait staff and bus boys can't maintain the level of service there once was.  The food is sub-par - I had to return the Carpaccio because it was truly disgusting.  We had 6 people in our group and there were 3-4 separate checks for the group.  Why are they adding 20% gratuity on each of the checks for a party of 6.  Unreal and uncalled for.  The ceiling needs work - there are huge open vents with freezing cold air blowing through them.  Hope they can get their act together, or they will lose their client base.

I have been here few times for happy hours, always love their martini choice. My husband and I took my sister for dinner,  the Apple martini always is my favorite drink. The clams steamed sauce is so good with their bread. My sister love the Chicken pasta with cream sauce. The meat ball just like the grandma homemade, We can not stop eating it.
The service was very good and friendly, My sister ask " Can we come back again before I went back?" We will denfinitely come back!!!

My wife and I love this "hidden gem"! Brett is an amazing bar tender and Rick, the manager is constantly engaged with his customers! The food is always wonderful and the portion size is perfect. The drinks a great too! We love the fact that they have live entertainment on the weekends and the small dance floor gets crowded. This is definitely our "go to " when we are on that side of town. We really enjoy their other lounge "VB Lounge", which is closer to where we live. Bother worth checking out! Cheers!

Went for an early lunch on a weekday.  The restaurant was pretty empty, but it was just open, like I said it was early.  The restaurant itself is very beautiful.  The service was perfectly fine.  The food was great.  

The tomato bruschetta was excellent.  The gnocchi (specifically ordered due to William H, 8/18/12 yelp review) was very very good.  

Not ready to give 5 stars yet, would like to go and see how they do when busier.  But I will go back!

Okay, I cannot say enough good things about this place. Yum. Yum yum yum yum YUM! This is hands-down the BEST Italian restaurant I have ever had the pleasure of eating at. I went for a celebratory dinner with my boyfriend after one year together and the atmosphere in the dining room was just lovely. Very romantic.

Now on to my favorite part: the food. My guy had the Penne Sicilian, which was good, but not really something to rave about. I had the Gnocchi alla Vodka, a, and I quote, "homemade potato gnocchi in a pink vodka sauce with shallots, fresh tomatoes and a touch of cream". Absolutely heavenly. I scraped all the sauce off my plate just to be able to taste how wonderful it was until the very end. The homemade gnocchi was exactly the right texture and the whole dish just worked together so wonderfully. You need to try this. You deserve to try this! I dream about dishes like this one, seriously.

The dessert was also fantastic. We split a raspberry tartufo (we were so stuffed from the huge portions of pasta) and it was a great finish to the dinner. The final bill wasn't ridiculous, especially for the quality of the food (on my end, at least) and the atmosphere. I thought it was very reasonable and will definitely be looking forward to my next visit there soon.

Found this place on Idine and tried it for lunch. Very nice place with a very large bar. On the high end side if that is what you are looking for. Food was excellent and service was very good. I had the linguine with chicken and mushrooms in a cream sauce with a glass of white wine. They brought over some good crusty French bread and I had a wonderful food experience. What I also liked was that the menu was overloaded. You have enough to pick from but not too much so you know the chef can do everything properly and fresh. Will go back for dinner soon.

Our third visit to Va Bene this month, and we have become fans! Rick, the GM, has been most cordial and helpful, and Daniel was a very efficient server, as was Laurie in the lounge... although Sergio was overwhelmed when we went on a Saturday evening, The Martinis and Calamari were wonderful [and quite inexpensive] when we went to Happy Hour... and the Sea Bass [Basso] was one of the best that we have had. We plan to return regularly!

This place is an Italian restaurant with decent food and and very good wine list with prices and ambiance leaning toward the upscale.  I had been here once with my sister for dinner shortly after they opened and found the prices to be higher than the quality of food and service warranted and so promptly forgot about it and never came back (and apparently never even wrote a review).

Flash forward to last Friday night when I am out with a bunch of ladies celebrating not one but two birthdays. We were in a party mood and so opted to sit in the bar area.  Boy, we did not know what we were in for.  Crazy loud music with a total meat market atmosphere. Unfortunately the band that night was a funk/r&b band which is not at all our style. After watching the cougars stalk their prey and the odd couples on the dance floor gyrate to Prince and Parliament songs for a couple hours, I was ready to get out of there. I think with a different band I may have enjoyed it a little more but I generally prefer a more laid back atmosphere and to be able to talk to my friends at the table without having to shout.

On the plus side, the food was very good.  My favorite Italian place in this part of town is Vincitorio's (on Elliott and McClintock) but I don't really care for their linguine with clams dish so I took advantage and ordered it here at Va Bene and it did not disappoint one bit.  I mean, it was so good I ate the whole thing and then mopped up the sauce with the rest of the bread in the basket.  Yum!  I also sampled some of my neighbors Gnocchi and that was fantastic as well.  Everyone at the table of 8 girls seemed to love their food and we all ordered different wines by the glass and no one was disappointed in that, either.

So, if you are in Ahwatukee looking for good Italian food and good wine and you don't mind spending a few extra bucks then this is a good option (Caffe Boa just up the road is a more affordable with same ambiance) but don't come on a Friday or Saturday night unless you are looking to party, hook-up, or shake your booty... or maybe all three!

I took a client out to eat at Va Bene's, one of my favorite local restaurants. After waiting a half hour for a salad, they completely screwed it up. My client nicely, but rightfully rejected it, and the asshole waiter literally patted my 60-year-old CEO client on her head (WTF!) and told her it was fine even though it was loaded with the very foods she had specifically requested be left off. Not cool!  He didn't like my request to take it back and sabatoged every aspect of the meal for the reminder of the night, from ignoring us, screwing up what were supposed to be free desserts, mischarging us, dumping off take-home boxes with no bag, serving the meal without silverware, and just generally providing horrendous service that was unbefitting for this establishment. This s*it show dragged on for 2 hrs with mistake after mistake and major attitude. I was deeply embarrassed and will never be back, let alone ever bring a client.
