Don't come here after 9pm to have a nice dinner. That was around the time the bar gets hopping...with old people. They were loud and took away from the restaurant experience. Luckily for them the food saved them on this review. The main course was good and so was the tiramisu. The bread was good but they don't give you much. The kind they give you comes with a olive oil type butter that was interesting and pretty good.

So husband and I decided to try a new place, wow disappointing. They served him chicken with what tasted like canned cream of chicken soup poured over it, cold mashed potatoes & mushy vegetables. I had the pizza it was alright, wine was good (had to ask for Moscato not on wine menu) the booth next to us looked like there was a mob hit, big hole. The paint was peeling from the ceiling from water damage. I ordered a slice of the cheesecake to go, got home and found it to be unetible! Completely dried out must have been in the refrigerator for about a week. Sadly disappointed.

First, there are not that many Maserati's!!!  

A visit to Va Bene is not complete unless you start at the bar.  Matt knows how to tend bar and take care of his regular customers.  The scallops are no longer a part of the 1/2 price appetizers during happy hour.....be a big boy, buck up and buy them anyway, worth every last penny. 

If you find your way in after happy hour - expect to find dancing and large crowds in the bar.  This is the place for adults to see and be seen in The Tuke!

On the restaurant side, dinners are terrific and the Chef's Specials should always be considered.  Great service and friendly staff.

Va Bene is a gem in the area.  Great food, staff and reasonable prices.  A great place for dinner - just watch out for the cougars!

My wife and I love this place. We had Lemon-Drop and Cosmopolitan Martinis, and two of the Pollo con Pesto pizzas, along with their complimentary bread is to die for. The dance floor gets crowded on Friday night, but it is a wonderful place to have fun with friends and family.

Terrible. I don't usually write reviews but this must be said. I'm pregnant and would eat anything but after tonight's experience everything BUT Va Bene. Now I know what it tastes like to drown in ocean water because that's what my meal tasted like, a mouthful of salty sea water. So disappointed.

Dropped in for a late lunch. Had been here once before and enjoyed it. This time we both enjoyed lunch salmon salad and linguini alla pesto with Rocky Point shrimp. A screwdriver and Chardonnay complimented the meal perfectly as did the service at the bar by Peter ... a great lunch!

I honestly don't know why this place has such high ratings.
First off, upon walking in and letting the seating hostess know we would like to sit in the dining area, as the lounge was BLASTING with music, mind you, I LOVE MUSIC, but it sounded like a full blown stadium concert, I asked where the bathroom was, she pointed and said very edgy, "Last door." I figured that she was trying to be straightforward because of how loud it was.
I found my boyfriend in the lounge and he said he was glad I had gone to the bathroom because when he walked in the manager or supervisor was yelling at his employees, dropping "f" bombs and didn't even have the decency to at least close the curtain. While he is telling me this, I hear more yelling, we try to ignore it and enjoy our night.
We got our food and OMG!!! Can you say SALTY!?! And that doesn't go just for their food but a bit towards our waiter, as well. With food that salty, at least make sure I have water so I can wash it down, and don't look at me like I'm a bother when I politely ask for more water and am the only one in the dining area.
My boyfriend is also one of those, when we go out, he wants an appetizer, main course and dessert but before he could even ask about dessert, the waiter came with our check, dropped it on the table and left, at least he cleared our plates as he walked away.
Overall, the only good thing was their warm bread that came with tomato basil butter and the guy who wasn't even our server but was there to help out.
We will not be returning.

We Love this place! Although the food is to die for, and they have some good vegetarian options, my review will focus on the wine bar/entertainment.

 There are very few places around town that a person who is not in their 20's anymore can get their groove on. This is it! 

Va Bene is an upscale (read: no base ball hats) wine bar that has a full bar, a dance floor and a stage! The decor is very classy with deep red long velvet drapes. Seating is around the HUGE bar, tall tables that seat 4 with white tablecloths and intimate booths (yes, IN THE BAR!)  They have great outdoor patio space on 2 sides of the restaurant with heat lamps in the winter and a nice counter height fire pit.

Va Bene hosts the best bands around like The Soul Solution (these girls can SING!!) and the sax player Todd is amazing!) and Contra Band. The bartenders and wait staff are friendly and make really great drinks. Try the Chocolatini!

The crowd is a high energy, great mix of everyone and it can get quite crowded between 9 and 11pm. You will see anything from sequins to nice jeans to suits.

FYI  The 2 corner bar seats on the left are reserved for my friend Kiki and I when the Soul Solution is playing. If you sit there you will be glared at by everyone. Lol!

Located thousands of miles from Tuscany is no challenge to this fabulous Italian Ristorante. I wish my stomach could accommodate more as every dish is elegant and delicious. Sipping on a bottle of Sartori Pinot Grigio and sampling our 4 course dinner is the epitome of Italian cuisine. Do yourself a flavor and book your reservation today.

This is a great spot for happy hour or after hour drinks. I recommend dining in the bar/lounge as the dining room is a little stiff. The bar is elegant and large with very comfortable bar stools. There are several TVs which are usually playing a sporting game of some sort. Our bartender, Tyler, was fantastic! They offer generously sized $6 martinis with well liquor. The price drops to $4.50 for happy hour, which is unbeatable!

Unfortunately, I wasn't terribly impressed with the food. It wasn't bad by any means but it was lacking. The pasta was quite overcooked, there was way too much cheese on the salads (thick slabs of bland mozzarella), the chicken piccata was somewhat bland, the sausage was extremely undercooked. So much so that we had it sent back to the kitchen. Tyler was very cool about it and gave us a cocktail on the house. 

Although I'm a little disappointed with the food, I very much approve of the laid back bar scene and the extra friendly bartenders. With a little added passion in the kitchen, they will be well on their way to being one of the hottest spots in town. 

Give it a shot, you may really enjoy it! It's got lots of potential.

Came here Friday night for date night with my husband and we had a wonderful time. The wait staff were very friendly and helpful with the menu. They have a great menu and their food is delicious! The atmosphere there is very nice  and such a great place to go for a nice dinner with your significant other. I love this place and we will definitely be back for more. They also have a great happy hour in the bar.

This is easily one of the most consistently great places I visit. I'm a bar-person who tends to also make use of the patio. Everyone, from the bartender to the bus staff, always says hello and offers help. The food is fantastic and the weekend music is always a plus.

Ok so this place would have been 5 stars if my creme brûlée wasn't burnt, yes I'm that picky. Lol. 

Let me start off by saying the waiter was awesome on point and always following up with us, he gave suggestions and always had a smile in his face. Now for the food- we started off with the calamari and it was AWESOME....I asked if the had Cannelloni but I was out of luck fortunately the waiter suggested something else the chicken pasta with mushrooms (not the correct name but you should be able to find it on the menu) and it was great. The over all atmosphere was great and service was on point. I will definitely be going back.

First time we've been to this place and it started off good but went down from there. Our waiter never checked on us. Never asked how our food tasted or refilled drinks. Too bad for him because I would have loved another glass of wine but I was never asked. The food was very salty for me. The hostess never thanked us for coming in, she just sat there on her phone texting. For this kind of service and not really great food, I don't think it's worth the money.

I always say "No one does Northern Italian cuisine well in Arizona!", but I am absolutely wrong!  Va Bene is the epitome of fine, affordable, Northern Italian cuisine!  In fact, I order one of the specials every time I go and they are simply as good as it gets.  I tip my hat off to their chef -- I will never say you can't find good Italian food in the Phoenix area, again.  I look forward to my next visit.

great service and the food is excellent.  I usually have the rigatoni bolognese or the gnocchi in vodka cream sauce they both are outstanding if your in the mood for pasta.  they have a great happy hour and live music Friday and Saturdays.

We were in a party of about 20.  We had 1 waiter. We sat there over a hour for bread to arrive.  Service was horrible.  Hardly seen the 1 waiter we had.  At one point we wanted to change seats due the family of the birthday girl came late and we thought we would want to sit with her sons.   The waiter happened to be in the room when we did it and basically yelled at us like we were 5 years old.  It was so unprofessional!    When he arrived with my food, it wasn't what I ordered so I asked for at least another type of sauce to put on it, never saw the sauce.  Never came back after that  to ask if we needed anything. I finally asked him for our bill and he was very rude. Told me he was getting it but it was difficult with so many people and all having separate bills. With the party of 20 gratuity was automatically added to our bill.  Our server didn't even deserve a tip.  If you plan on having a dinner party I would not recommend this establishment.  Horrible!

I went there for the first time last night.
 I had a lots of fun there last night . The band was great ! The drinks were great ! The atmosphere was great! I would recommend it to others I will go again.

I have been a regular for years. Everyone here is great! The food is awesome,, The bar is beautiful and they are all nice and very professional. I recommend to many friends and they all leave happy! Try it-- you won't regret it!

From our entire family to your team - we want to say a heartfelt thank you for the kindness, hospitality, and generosity you showed us in our time of need. 

After my mothers passing, we chose Va Bene for a memorial dinner, and you handled it professionally, respectably, and delicately for us during a very emotional time. 

The food was unbelievable, the choice of wine (which we left up to you) was perfect, and the atmosphere was both warm and comforting. Thank you again for everything.

COME SEE RICK. HE IS OUTSTANDING! Wow. What a
Personality, can we bring him to Chicago!? He really is the grease to the wheels of this establishment.  He was recommended to come see by Anne from wild horse pass casino and resort.  Must stop in!! bands, amazing clean atmosphere and unbelievable drinks.  The calamari is so delicious a cooked to perfection, and I'm a calamari snob. Thank you yelp.   COME HERE!!!'FUN AND CLASSY.

Top marks for the service, very attentive and on the spot. Calamari was great and very enjoyable. The stuffed pork chop was a tad on the salty and dry side, no horrible but not top notch. Salmon was well presented and very good. Prices are good so definately well worth the meal, overall a good experience worth a return visit.
The place is very nice, staff is friendly and the food is decently priced.. we ordered chicken Marsala and rigatoni bolognese both were good.. can't wait to come back to try their other stuff

The steak here blows the doors off any other steak house you may think is the best.   You have not had the best until you've had it here.  The service is always 5 star.  The portions and presentations are just right.  The desserts here are amazing. This place has a European flare;  cloth tablecloths and napkins.  It's a great place for a special occasion and always well prepared.  The cook may not match up the menu to what is in season entirely.  But it is always done right and never disappoints.  I have been here several times and always highly satisfied in every aspect and nothing left on my plate.  Highly recommended.

We ate here as a part of my conference. My Italian boss's wife chose the place. The service was fantastic and the calamari were huge. I enjoyed the veal piccata the veal was tender but a bit salty for me. The sang me happy birthday and brought me a dessert, it tasted fine but I don't eat sugar so not really my thing. 

I cannot say enough good about how the service was with almost 20 of us they did great a couple of mix ups on who got what but that's to be expected

I met some girlfriends for Happy Hour on a Monday, which must be the least popular day for happy hour, as the place was completely empty. Appetizers were delish - prosciutto wrapped prawns, bruschetta and eggplant drenched in cheese and marinara sauce. The wine list was pricey and not that impressive of a selection. They don't have a cocktail menu, but have some specialty drinks that the bartender will tell you about if you ask. The ambiance was just ok for the prices. The bartender was really funny and full of great suggestions.  

This is NOT a place I would take my preschooler - the restaurant would not mind, but there's no kid food on the menu and there is nothing entertaining about the ambiance.

Apparently, this place is a wild dance club in disguise! The place turns into a dance floor on Friday and Saturday nights where the 70's, 80's and 90's music is pumpin. If you want to shake your thing in Ahwatukee, this seems to be the place. (I may just try it out and report back.)

We had such a great experience at Va Bene tonight! The food was amazing (especially the Tarragon Muscles) and our bartender Shelley was excellent! I highly recommend trying Shelley's specialty drink, the Italian Lemon Martini!

I have been here about five times for happy hour.   The happy hour is great because all the appetizers are half off.   The food is amazing!  I have only eaten in the bar so I am looking forward to having dinner here soon.

It's been some time since I've been in Va Bene. So I grabbed a Groupon and dropped in on a Sunday evening for dinner in the bar.  My first impression was pleasant; there wasn't a plethora of Cougars sitting around the bar ready to pounce. Ordered a bottle of wine and Michelle suggested a dish that wasn't on the menu that would pair well with the wine. It was fabulous!  Great dinner with fabulous service!

Go to spot when I'm in town. I remember coming here when they first opened and have been in love ever since! Menu is authentic Italian and the staff is trained to know and ready to answer any questions. Aside from professionalism I always feel at home while here for you'll have the chef come out to ask how your meal is or the owner come by to say hi. Server Samantha, Dylan and bartender Brett always provide an amazing experience. Escargot, mussels, siciliana, gnocchi and espresso creme brûlée are must haves! Ask for a wine pairing and you'll never want to leave.

It was okay... We didn't had a reservation and planned to either sit in the bar or patio area. The patio area had a lot of smokers, so they told us we could sit in the front where it was non smoking... They hostess took us out front and it was completely unlit. She brought us a candle, which did nothing. We moved over to the other side of the patio which had a little more light. The patio seats' webbing was broken. We had to switch them with other tables on our own. I later saw other customers also finding broken seats at their tables. 

Our waitress was friendly. The food was decent, but not fantastic.  I had the ahi tuna. It was unmemorable.  My friend had the pollo alla pizzaiola which was tasty. But overall, not worth the price..

Service was good but food was just ok, nothing to write home about. They do have live music on Saturday night but unfortunately we didn't care for the band we heard the night we went. The restaurant itself is very nice inside though

No thanks not going here again... Me and my girlfriend used to love coming here that is until last night totally ruined that for us. My dad was visiting from out of town and we were telling him we had to take him here so we get there at around 9:15 their hours says 10 o'clock they close ok so working in the business myself I think 45 minutes is a reasonable time that your not being a dick and coming in right before their about to close. So the pros food is always good. The owner who actually took care of us for most of our time there was very nice and helpful as well as a server there Daniel is very good and friendly. We are there for about 5 minutes just got our drinks when the bartender comes over and says "do you guys know what you want the kitchens waiting on you I think they're trying to get out of here" ........ I consider us very easy going customers but I have never felt so uncomfortable out to eat in my life.. Even if that's the case don't EVER say that to a paying customer that's just a huge no no. And as I said it wasn't like we came in right before they were closing they were open for another 45 minutes!! My dad even said something about it to us and he's been in the business his whole life and is as easy going as it kids. It was just a very uncomfortable feeling and it made the dinner very awkward the rest of the time we felt rushed and tried to eat as fast as possible as we felt like a burden being there. Also when the food runner brought out the dishes my girlfriend asked if she could have some pepper on her pasta dish. Very reasonable request very common the food runner was nice about it and obliged he comes back to the table with red crushed pepper she had wanted the ground black pepper. Easy mistake obviously so problem but the food runners reaction was just the icing on the cake to the whole meal he gave her this disgusted look and rolled his eyes I couldn't believe it. I thought at first I was the only one who saw it but then when he walked away my girlfriend said something about it too. We were very disappointed like I said food is always great here and reasonably priced and any service we've had hear from Daniel and another couple people that work in the bar area it has always been great but this time was enough to make us never go back. The lack of professionalism was amazing to me especially at a place of that caliber. Very sad because we enjoy the food maybe we will get takeout but probably won't be back. Oh and I had the stuffed pork on the menu 18.95 when we get the bill 22.95??? I could care less about the money I still would've got it if it said 22.95 on the menu but that's definitely illegal charging different prices then what's on the menu.. Very odd and disappointing

Great food and atmosphere. The chicken and mushroom alfredo is amazing. We started with the muscles in sausage and peppers and finished the meal off with a homemade tiramisu. Everything was fantastic and the service was excellent. 

We will definitely be back. One of my favorite Italian restaurants.

When I see escargot on a menu, I never pass it up!!!  Escargot Sautéed with garlic and a creamy gorgonzola cheese baked in a puff pastry with a spicy mustard sauce....YUM!  Wow. Enjoyed it so much. There also was a drizzle of a sweet strawberryish sauce in the sides of the plate. Oh so nice. A gentle blend of flavors that simply melted in my mouth!  Puff pastry was a tad undercooked, but only a tad. It was too good...I want to go back and have more. 

I was debating on veal Marsala or the stuffed pork chop with prosciutto. The waiter suggest a non-menu item: veal parmigiana. So I went with that. Never had it like this. I did wish I ordered the Marsala. That being said it was very good. Tomato sauce was so fresh. I did like the leaves of fresh basil I could mix in with the meal. Made a huge difference. The thinly prepared veal was sitting on a bed of spaghetti flat noodles.  A nice portion. The veal...each bite, every single one, tasted tender and had a mellow flavor. (I do. It think they were breaded). What I am trying to say is that each bite tasted identical. Yes!  Each bite was equally tender. Each piece of meat was wonderfully prepared before cooking.   

Service was friendly and service was done in a timely manner. I had forgotten what cheese was in the escargot, before it arrived and asked the waiter. He did not know. That surprised me a bit.   

Someone did order the stuffed pork chop. Came sliced resting in a clear mushroom sauce. He said it was a little dry but tasty and the sauce was not as flavorful as he would have liked. Overall...he liked it!

Outstanding Italian food. Make a reservation if you know you are going. They like to act like sticklers about reservations. Ambiance is is a bit like modern Italian. Prices are reasonable for how good the food is. Fettuccine de pollo and fungi is very good. As is their meat sauce.

Food was okay server kept coughing. Kept waters filled. Chef did an okay job with fettuccini with chicken and mushrooms needed some spice maybe a touch of rosemary. For a martini bar there dirty martinis are not very dirty. I would probably not go back.

Dropping them a star for my last experience. Bartender could not have been less interested. No excuse when there are only 2 couples in the entire restaurant at 5 on a Monday!

I won't be coming here when Michelle is working the bar anymore. The experience of sitting at a bar and enjoying some drinks and food is meant to be shared. She would drop off a drink and run to the other side of the bar. No type of personal connection. With Randy its the complete opposite. The owners should take heed of this.

We were looking forward to eating here. Reviews pretty good. The service and atmosphere were very nice. It's just that the food lacked in flavor. Had to add salt which we hated doing. Will not return.

We went the day before Valentine's Day. Sadly, they were out of veal that evening so I ordered the lamb. It was incredibly tender and tasty. We ordered the salmon as well and came away unimpressed by the overall taste. It was cooked properly but was missing something. We also shared a tiramisu for dessert which was average tasting. The wine selection was incredible and the glasses that it was served in were classy and artistic.
The atmosphere was very nice but the hostess was wearing jeans. We would have been more impressed if she had been wearing slacks. The background music in the restaurant area was perfect......Sinatra and Tony Bennett....nice.

I would give this place another 1/2 star if they had a better selection of wine. The food was great, the atmosphere was good, live music was a nice touch. The service was above average. The patio outside was great with misters, but people were smoking out there so that was a definite negative. Over all it was great and we will go back!

Delicious. The food here was so tasty and the service was great. We came here around 9 PM on a Thursday and it was pretty empty which was fine. The three of us in my group ordered pasta, I got the rigatoni with meat sauce and it was perfect! I even tried my SO and friends food and it tasted delicious as well. This is a cute little hidden spot that looks like it's been here a while and has accumulated some bar regulars. I just wish they played Italian music throughout the restaurant to give it a more authentic feel. I would hear Taylor swift in the dining area but big band swing music in the bathroom. And the prices are kinda expensive too but overall I had a good experience!

This place is very nice.  The atmosphere is dark and relaxing.  Goodfor a date or a night out. Food is delicious and reasonably priced.  The portions Jette are good size to.  You can just about split a pasta and salad.  Servers are also very friendly and attentive.  I would go back for sure.

I really wish Va Bene was closer.  The happy hour is amazing (try the eggplant dish!) with great specials on food and drinks.  I've had the vodka sauce pasta, and that was pretty tasty, but mainly I stick to the appetizers and drink specials.  Luckily, they have happy hour 5 days a week!  The crowd is a bit older and they have karaoke after happy hour.  If you're a 40something on the prowl, watch out!  Otherwise, come earlier, or sit in the dining room to avoid the cougars.

When we first arrived we went into the bar and were basically ignored. The hostess eventually brought some menus over. However, once our server came over from that point forward everything was great! We had the steamed clams which were delicious.  The gnocchi was some of the best I've ever had. Highly recommend. They have a great happy hour as well.

I live close to this place and every night it has a good amount of people hanging out on the patio where they have a fire pit and a wine bar. We happened to go on a very slow night for a nice italian restaurant/bar, because it was the same night the NFL conference championships were playing. We tried the bacon wrapped shrimp (4 pieces of small shrimp) as an appetizer, and I was very disappointed by the overcooked, tasteless pieces of shrimp. I chose the "special" for the night, which was not very special. It was described by the waitress as a "Prime Porterhouse" steak, with brussell sprouts cooked with bacon and pecans as a side. The steak was definitely not as tender as prime beef should be, and it was a T-bone at best, NOT a porterhouse size portion as described. This mediocre dish was $38, which is more expensive than anything on the regular menu. Being that it was a "special", I did not think to ask the price before ordering. The only good thing about this place was the stiff drinks that our waitress poured. Other than that, I probably wont have any reason to go back anytime soon.

We were looking for a nice place to enjoy a quiet dinner. Since we not from the area we took a chance based on the Yelp reviews and I'm happy to repetitious that Va Bene is a winner. The dimly lit interior sets the mood. The wine list has some nice choices across the price ranges and the menu has the standard as well as some unique dishes. We started with a glass of Pinot Grigio to accompany the Mussels with Sausage. The light red sauce was tasty and this interesting combination was great. We each had a salad next. Both the Caesar and Mediterranean salads were good. Fresh veggies and decent dressing. We ordered a Chianti to accompany the Mains. Chicken W/ Asparagus in. Lemon sauce with fresh mashed potatoes and Broccoli was excellent. Tender chicken and veggies cooled to perfection. The Rotini w/ Eggplant was also wonderful. Cubes of eggplant in a rich fresh tomato sauce.

This restaurants food, decor and service was outstanding! It had a great romantic atmosphere, perfect for my boyfriends bday dinner tonight! The food was delicious, from appetizers all the way to their fabulous tiramisu! (We even took a second piece home!) I had the risotto while my boyfriend had the pesto pasta and they were both just fantastic! All staff members were very nice and attentive!  We will definitely be going back!

We had read several reviews of VB on Yelp that were less than stunning, but we have been trying to find a good Italian restaurant, so we wanted to try it and we had a very enjoyable evening.

Our server, Boris, was knowledgeable, efficient and had some good suggestions. (For example, my wife ordered the veal piccata and he suggested fettuccini as an accompaniment instead of the mashed potatoes that it comes with.) 

The food was excellent, as I said above, my wife had the vela piccata and I ordered the linguini vignole.  Each was well prepared and the pasta with each was al dente.

The wine selection is extensive and offered a good variety.

Overall, we had a great time.

We made a reservation for 9pm on a weekday. We walked in before 9 and there was no one to seat us. We waited for a bit thinking that they would notice we were there. After about 10 minutes.. I walk towards the bar and THEN someone came to get us a table. It was quite dark in the dining room and the food was way over priced for the "Olive Garden" taste. The only reason for the two stars is the waiters service was not bad and the food was edible.
Very intimate setting. Very reasonable prices. Had the Lemmon chicken with asparagus..was delicious! Will return

We came here for happy hour one evening.. 4 stars? Of course we have to check it out..

They have happy hour from 4-7. For food we ordered the Bruschetta, and the Melanzane Ripieni. The bruschetta was ok. It was just mainly tomatoes on it. I felt like a slice of cheese with it would've been perfect. It was no meat friday again so these items were perfect. The Melanzane was good. It's baked and filled with eggplant, cheese, zucchini, etc. I felt they could use some more items on their appetizer menu. It's mainly all seafood. Mussels, calamari, scallops etc. 

For the drinks... I was kind of shocked that they don't have a drink menu. They don't have a regular drink menu, wine menu, or anything. You basically tell them what you want and that's it. The first time, I ordered a Strawberry Martini while my friend got a Cosmo. Then we told our waitress, can you just have the bartender mix up a fruity martini. I'm not sure what was in it, but it was really good! The good news is their martinis are really good and they're a steal! $4! 

I would really recommend having a drink menu though, maybe throwing some specialty drinks on it along with a wine list and perhaps expanding the happy hour menu with the appetizers. I'd come back for a martini though for a price like that! =)
Escargot heaven!  Had to order a second round-it was that good! Risotto Mare Monte was to die for!
Great place to visit.  Found it on yelp.  They kept the kitchen open for our group of 5 and gave us a custom chef made meal. Grouper is awsome. Service was top notch
My favorite restaurant! Great Service. The calamari is excellent. I have never had a bad meal or service at Va Bene. I always sit in the bar area. They have excellent wine selection.

This time I went in with just a white T-shirt.  Out of respect, I ask the host if the restaurant would serve me and I told her I will be glad to get dress for this place.  It was 118°F outside with record breaking heat in Phoenix so she said no problem.  Asked for a seat and enjoying my appetizer while I waited for my partner.   The dinner was nice and server were attentive but the bussers were less than friendly initially.  Smart wait staff would sale like I did but I saw none of that.  Since I knew exactly what I wanted and got what I need, it was a decent experience.

Great place for a date night. The salads are amazing!!!! Sweet glazed pecans and fresh vinaigrettes make their salads stand out from the rest. I always enjoy the Risotto it is always cooked to perfection!!! The margarita pizza is another fav. 
 The happy hour specials are great as well if you happen to go during the hours of 4-7pm.

An added bonus is the live jazz band that plays and sings in the bar area. (During certain times)

The food was great and the prices were very reasonable. The restaurant is gorgeous inside and out and the environment was peaceful. Usually when I get large portions I worry about food qaulity, but in this case, I was served a large portion of great quality food.

Quite satisfied! My wife and I were looking for a new date-night spot and came across this joint on Yelp. We checked it out and we're impressed with the atmosphere, the service, the food, and the prices. Happy hour deals are great (ex: half-off appetizers and $1 off wine) and the food was terrific. We sat in the bar area and shared the beer-battered calamari (which was delicious!) and enjoyed the fettuccine with cream sauce pasta dish for our main course. The service was also fine--nothing too great, but kept our drinks full. Overall, a nice evening. We would definitely try it again when we're in that area.

Went here yesterday for the 2nd time. ordered a cosmo YUM. The bartender was awesome.   The mood in the restaurant is very dark and the bar is impressive. 

The bread was fresh out of the oven and the perfect mix of doughy and crispy

Got the eat and cheese platter. I would recommend it. 

I ordered penne with the meat sauce and my boyfriend got the curry linguine wit shrimp. Mine was war better - the meat sauce is delicious. The curry linguine left much to be desired.

Overall, friendly, attentive, pretty good food. Will be back when I have a craving for some pasta.

This is a delightful restaurant with cozy ambiance. The menu is typical Italian and all our choices were excellent. We especially liked the sausage rigatoni and the seafood bisque. We had very attentive servers and thoroughly enjoyed our evening.
Omg everything was delicious and authentic. Lunch: Apple walnut salad and clams are a must, espresso brule is to die for. Beautiful dining area. Very intimate, definitely good for date night.
Good food and very nice bartenders ( Roberto and Rick) but the band  left a lot to be desired. Hurt your ears if you're into music.

We had the prime rib and the stuffed pork. Both were delicious!  Prime rib was perfectly cooked. Sauce was just right. The stuffed pork was yummy as well. Wine and beer selections are great too. Would highly recommend.

Great food from this little place tucked away in a strip mall in Ahwatukee. We had a lovely lunch with friendly, helpful service. Starters were fantastic - full flavored vegetables including eggplant and zucchini, and some tomato bruschetta. I've had better bruschetta but this stuff seemed to work. Our party of six enjoyed a few different pasta dishes, mine was a great olive oil, tomato, and garlic delight. I'd definitely try this place again for dinner in the future.

Midway typing my review, I decided to read others.   Were we just lucky that night??   The food was excellent as was the service.  I thought the prices were reasonable except for the Grouper special at $32 which needed some type of sauce on it.  Would we ever return??  Absolutely!  Just wished it was closer to Gilbert

Found them on Groupon so decided to give them a try. Went there on a Monday evening. Hostess wasn't welcoming or friendly when we arrived and it was the same when we left. The restaurant was empty so I'm not sure what the issue was with that. 

We were seated in the dining room which was nice and quiet. Our server was great. Friendly, upbeat, and knowledgeable about the food and wine menus. He made great meal suggestions and the service was fast. We ordered calamari to start and had the linguine vongole and the penne aglio olio peperoncino con broccoli.  The food was amazing and portion size was on point. We ate it ALL. I don't even know how we managed. It was so good, we just couldn't stop eating.  

There were only two things I would've changed about our visit. First, when our main dishes were brought out, they left our empty appetizer plate on the table (this wasn't our server). It would have been nice if it were cleared off after putting down the main course or even prior. It ended up sitting on our table for a little bit. When our server came back to check on us, he saw it and quickly cleared it off. Next, would be the hostess. They are the first and last interaction guests experience with the restaurant. I would think a little training would help in both cases. 

But overall, we enjoyed it and plan on returning again.

My wife and I visited for our weekly Friday night out and we'll certainly be back. The food was excellent. PJ had one of the daily specials, orange roughy in asparagus sauce, and I had the rigatoni bolognese. The service was top notch and checked on us often throughout the evening making recommendations along the way.

As much as we like him, we could have done without the constant Frank Sinatra music. At least throw in a little Tony Bennett once in a while, guys. ;)

Overall relaxing atmosphere in the restaurant side. We didn't even know there was a bar until we took a detour to the restrooms on the way out and exited through the bar which, while quite noisy, couldn't be heard from the dining room.

The place is tucked away in a corner of a strip mall, not where I'd expect it to be at all considering the dining experience which was fancy without being intimidating AND without breaking the bank.

I've been here several times for happy hour and dinner. If you're coming for happy hour on the weekend beware, the place gets very full and it can be a challenge to find a seat. I'm an Italian food fanatic and I must say they do a really solid job. Some things are a little different from back east but everything is tasty and well executed. The only negative about Va Bene is sometimes the service is a little slow. It's like after all of this time in business they don't know when to expect a crowd... really? Don't get me worng, it's never been so slow that I wanted to leave or anything, it's just that it shouldn't take that long to pour a glass of wine. Oh by the way, the Calamari is really good, lightly battered and cooked properly -- try it.

Great food, atmosphere. The Calamari and Caprese were delicious! The service was fantastic!  The best part of the evening was the company and the staff was gracious about letting us enjoy our time together.  Memorable evening with fantastic friends and great food. Manga!

Visiting this area. First time here. Birthday celebration. Our server Boris was amazing. Great food and wine recommendations. There were seven of us including two children. Everyone was pleased with their entree choice. Calamari appetizer was one of the best I have ever had. Desserts were great.

We called ahead to ensure they were serving linguini with white clam sauce, mainly because my stepfather was craving it for about a month and a half.  We were assured they were.  I convinced my parents to come to Ahwatukee to dine at Va Bene instead of going to the West Valley because, well, you know I don't go West of 7th Avenue except in extreme circumstances.  

We arrived and found Va Bene's dining room to be extremely dark.  I am all for ambience, but when I am eating I like to have a little bit more light so I can appreciate the plating of the dish.  

We were seated in the dining room to the right of the host stand, which was nearly empty at 5:30 on a Saturday, but started to get a few tables by 6ish.

We ordered several appetizers, chianti and sangria for the table and five entrees, including two orders of linguini with white clam sauce.

As our appetizers were delivered, we were informed that the chef did not think the clams were any good.  If we were told this when placing the order (or when the order was put in), we would have chosen to go to another restaurant.  At this point, we were stuck having to order something else.  There was another seafood dish offered as a replacement, but it was a few dollars more per dish.  We went ahead and ordered it since we had no other real choice, but to stay.  Of course, we were glad to not be served bad clams!

The appetizers were hit or miss.  
The calamari was EXTREMELY chewy.  My daughter could not bite through them at all.  I had difficulty chewing through the rings and chose the tentacles instead.  The Melanzane Ripiene was delicious, but it was a very small portion.  I don't eat Carpaccio, but my mom said it was pretty good.  The bruschetta was average.

The linguini frutti di mare was also average, even prepared with a white wine and garlic sauce.  The mussels were a bit chewy.  

For my entree I had Fettuccine with mushrooms and artichokes.  I love artichokes in everything, so this was a win for me.

My mother had the risotto.  She said it was "just alright."  However, she ate a few bites and left the rest on her plate.  

My daughter was happy with a plate of spaghetti with butter and cheese.

At this price point, there are too many other better options for us to ever return.  We still had a nice time, but it was the company that saved the experience.

I can't believe I've never written a review of this place. 

I think they have delicious food.  I wish their calamari were better.  But the other items I've had on the menu are tasty.  I had no idea they had a formal dining room or a private dining room.  I've ALWAYS only gone to the Lounge.  The atmosphere in the lounge is usually energetic and fun.  THere is an outside patio if you like sitting outside.

I have gone here on weekend nights to hear live soul music and to dance.  The crowd is a 30+ crowd and I personally love that, since I am 30+.  :-)  I have been for HH and for the later hours for the band.  I think they have great HH offerings from the appetizer menu and for the drink menu. 

The service here has ALWAYS been top flight and top class.  I've never been disappointed with the quality of service here.  My only complaint about this establishment is that it is in Ahwatukee and not in a more central location.
